113.title: weight gain times two

choices: A Planet's Power Provides Potent Poundage Production
1131.content:
How will Krystal contract this weight gain-accelerating virus?

A Planet's Power Provides Potent Poundage Production:
You know the drill: Krystal sets off to investigate a mysterious planet, only to get more than she bargained for.

But if you'd like a little more detail...

A strange planet emitting telepathic waves has somehow drifted its way into the Lylat System. As Star Fox's resident psychic, Krystal takes it upon herself to investigate alone.

Appetite Over-Stimulant
Somehow, Krystal contracted a pathogen that doesn't seem to do anything but inhibit her appetite. There's a cure on the way, but until it's ready she'll have to fight through the sickness with appetite stimulants. And then the pathogen starts mixing with the medication...

Do either of these interest you?
1131.title: Weight Gain Times Two: Only Krystal

11311.content:
In a distant corner of the Lylat System sat a lone planet. A new planet, in fact. It just drifted into the system one day and stayed there, rotating but not orbiting. Scans suggested it was near identical to Corneria in terms of planetary habitability; breathable atmosphere, tolerable weather conditions, and even the right materials to develop a sustainable civilization. But with no transmissions from the strange planet or responses to Corneria's own, it was hard to say if intelligent life existed there. Stranger still, what the planet did transmit couldn't be picked up by radio scans, but by those select few blessed with telepathic abilities.

"... Which is why they've hired us to investigate instead of sending some of their own." Krystal stared at the planet from her view on the Great Fox's bridge. Despite maintaining a reasonable amount of distance, she could still pick up on the telepathic waves. Now if only she could discern their specifics...

"That's the gist of it." Peppy, seated in the captain's chair, nodded at her. "They're thinking that since you can pick up on 'em, you'll be able to sniff out...something or other."

Krystal frowned. "Right..."

"Still think they're getting the wrong people for the job," Falco said, arms crossed, gazing off in some random direction. "Just saying."

Fox shrugged. "Well, General Pepper can probably count the number of psychics he knows on one finger. Just like the rest of us."

"Point taken." Falco sighed. "But we're not exactly the go-to recon team, y'know? I mean, how do you expect four people to check out an entire planet all by themselves?"

"We're just supposed to find the source of those waves," Peppy said.

"What if they're coming from...I don't know, the center of the planet or something? And really, why can't they just use some kinda tele-whatever scanner?"

"'Cause there's no such thing," Slippy interjected. "Most folks don't even know psychic powers exist, so there's no research about that stuff."

"Then why don't you do something about it?"

"Hey, I've got my hands full enough as is! I wouldn't even know where to start anyway!"

Both Fox and Peppy attempted interject only to be cut off by Krystal audibly clearing her throat. The men all clammed up and looked at her.

"Since I'm the only one who can carry out this mission," she said, "I think it would be best if I go it alone for now."

Fox looked taken aback. "Alone? Are you sure?"

Krystal nodded. "I can't see much benefit in taking you all along with me. Maybe I'll need support if things get too dangerous, but we should at least confirm if there is a danger first."

Fox didn't reply. He stared at the floor, face strained in worried thought. After a moment, he looked up and said, "Alright, just be careful, Krystal."

She smiled. "Of course."

------

Rations and other necessities to last a week, check. Blaster and staff, check. Arwing all fueled up and good to go, check. With everything ready, Krystal launched the following day.

She still couldn't make anything out of the waves, even as she entered the atmosphere. No emotions or anything. Maybe it wasn't a sentient being sending them out. But then what was it? And how was it doing it? These questions plagued her all the way down to the surface.

Hills and grasslands covered the immediate vicinity. A mountain range dotted the horizon. Woodlands both to the east and west. No signs of civilization, developed or otherwise.

"Lovely," Krystal whispered to herself.

She shut her eyes and focused. The waves permeated the entire surface, yet she still couldn't discern anything. Anything, that is, except for their potential source southeast of her location. Turning her Arwing around, she gunned it in that direction, adjusting course every now and then the further she went.

Eventually, she came across...
11311.title: Mystery Planet

1133.content: So all three gain weight by the virus. Where shall it start?
1133.title: Krystal, Fox and Kat

11332.content: Should Krystal go alone or with Fox/Katt?
11332.title: On a distant planet.

113321.content:
As part of a solo mission, Krystal has been assigned to investigate the mysterious disappearances of locals on a planet called Gryious. As she entered the planet's atmosphere, she saw that the planet was a lush, swamp-like area with trees standing 500 feet high while the coast was muddy and surrounded by murky water. Finding an area to land was difficult with the thick vegetation. Having found a clearing in the swamp, she landed her Arwing on a muddy, soggy bank. Placing her space-suit on and opening the hatches, she entered the swampy planet with a splash in the water. The water was so dirty, she couldn't see her reflection in it and the slime was very thick.

"How did I get stuck with this mission?" she thought to herself. She didn't mind that the planet was warm and humid. If it wasn't so filthy and muddy, she'd feel right at home. Of course, in a big swamp like this, who knows what sorts of things could be lurking around. That fact Krystal kept in mind.

Venturing not to far away from her Arwing, she heard something coming from behind a bush. Removing the leaves, she discovered a...
113321.title: She goes alone.

1133212.content:
It looked like a cross between a possum and a lizard, but it shrilled like a frightened bird. It was the size of a bulldog and yet the vines were able to hold it 3 feet above the marshy water. Using a laser-like cutlass she packed with her, she sliced the vines off the creature and freed it. The creature thanked Krystal by licking her helmet. Krystal was happy to free this creature, but the moment didn't last long.

She heard something coming and so did the creature. It shrilled and ran away as fast as 25 mph. Krystal was worried. Whatever it could be coming must be very dangerous. Turning around, she saw something big was coming. Looking up, she could see something so big, it was blocking out the sun. Soon she could make out what it was. It was a giant...
1133212.title: Unusual Wildlife.

11332122.content: The vapor of mist was so large, it covered the tree-tops within seconds in its black vapor. But it didn't act like a normal mist. It was actually moving down the swampy canopy and toward the ground. Krystal tried to run toward her Arwing, but it was covered in the black mist. There were only two options she could do and what was to..
11332122.title: Fear the Black Mist.

113321221.content:
Pouncing head-first into the swampy depths, she managed to escape the terrifying cloud of black vapor as it rolled across the water's surface. Krystal couldn't believe what she was seeing. The mist was moving very fast and acted more like a hurricane than mist. Trees began to get knocked down, but thankfully, none landed on her.

When the frightening ordeal was over, Krystal swam toward the surface and when she rose, she saw that many of the trees were knocked down. As she rose from the water, she ran to check her Arwing. When she found it, she saw that it was spared during the terrible blast of that black cloud. Seeing that her Arwing was okay, Krystal decided to...
113321221.title: Into the Water.

choices: [WARNING!] The ship is critically damaged, and is in dire need of repairs.
[Alert!] The ship is somewhat damaged, but can still fly back to the Great Fox.
1133212211.content:
This planet was much more dangerous than any of them had anticipated, and it would be too risky to continue further exploration, at least not without thorough study of the planet’s ecosystem. Hell, for all they knew there might not be anything on this mudball worth the many hazards it seemed to contain! It might just be best to try to make a few scans… From orbit.

Just as she was stepping up to her Arwing however, she let out a surprised gasp as jets of what looked like the same black mist from before erupted from it in several areas. The dark, ominous smoke continue to pour out of Krystal’s vehicle for a few moments before collecting into a small, swirling cloud of the vapor that circled over it. Then, just as the last of the substance had exited her craft, the collective cloud shot straight at her! The vixen was prepared however, especially after seeing the behavior of the much larger cloud earlier, and quickly rolled out of the way, the mist missing her by inches.

Quickly, Krystal pulled herself out of the mud and, as soon as she was on her feet, drew her laser pistol to aim it at the menacing fog. As soon as she did though, she realized that it was not necessary as the small, dark mist was not headed towards her, but in the same direction its colossal companion had gone before, most likely to join with it again. The vixen shook her helmeted head and holstered her weapon, turning to inspect her Arwing once more.

The starfighter looked fine at first, well, besides all of the grime and muck from the swamp of course. Upon closer inspection however, Krystal saw that the areas the mist had poured out of seemed to have been corroded slightly, and there was some sort of black goop dripping from the spots in small quantities, most likely a more condensed form of the mist. Whatever it was, it seemed like it could potentially be acidic, and had perhaps even damaged her ship…

Worried about the state of her Arwing, Krystal opened up the cockpit and jumped inside, somewhat relieved when she was able to power it up without much difficulty, “Okay baby, let’s see if you can get me off this hellhole!”

Punching a few keys, the vixen waited as her on-board computer ran a diagnostic of the Arwing’s systems, hoping that it could still fly…
1133212211.title: Further Complications...

choices: A splash caused by a bizarre clam-like creature in the water...
It was a smaller mist cloud again, though this time it wasn't fleeing from her..
11332122111.content:
After a few minutes, the computer screen began to flash red, and several error messages popped up, a synthetic voice claiming, “Warning! This vessel has suffered severe internal stress! Immediate repair is recommended!”

“No!” Krystal huffed and smacked a gloved palm against her helmet in frustration, “This is just fantastic! Ughh, Fox is just going to love that I got one of these things trashed… and not even in a fight!”

She sighed and climbed back out of the cockpit, landing in the mud with a loud splat before closing it again and kicking the muck off of her boots. She looked about the area, surveying her surroundings, before groaning, “Great… Well, I guess I better tell him now. If I can’t get off this planet, he’ll just need to take me with him… how embarrassing!”

Krystal tapped a button on her suit’s collar to activate her communicator, but did not expect to hear the static that crackled through the speakers. Despite this, she began to speak, “Fox? Can you hear me? Fox, hello? There’s some kind of interference! I think my ship’s been wrecked, and I’m stuck here!”

A reply managed to come through, though unfortunately it was heavily distorted by the static, “Kry- I can harddd-zzzt! Fzz-ay where you-crzzz! The wildlife is too-FZZZZZT! –eird about this planet! Me and Katt are go-zzzztch-nd you and tr-“

After that the static began to overtake the communications channels, and Krystal could no longer manage to contact either Fox or Katt, let alone reach the Great Fox in orbit. She frowned as she let her paw fall to her side and leaned up against the Arwing.

“Fantastic… Now I guess I’m supposed to just wait around for rescue, like a freakin’ damsel…” She groaned, turning around and facing the Arwing, “I should probably get inside this thing and save the air in the suit for later…” She could very well need to use it later, especially if the atmospheric analysis comes up toxic… whenever it actually finishes.

Now that her mind was on analysis though, she figured that, since she had plenty of time and not much to do, she should probably get a sample of that weird mist crap. She pulled out a small kit from her belt and bent over to scrape some of the black goop leaking from her Arwing, carefully making sure that all of the potentially caustic slime made it into the sample container and not onto her suit.

“How disgusting…” She groaned as she put the sampling kit away, turning back towards the Arwing.
Just as she was about to hop in however, she heard a sound behind her…
11332122111.title: Waiting for Rescue...

choices: Go through the swamp and avoid the barnacles... if they're even worth avoiding..
Take the long way around the barnacles, but deeper into the wilderness.
113321221111.content:
The blue vixen turned around, her attention caught by the sound of something splashing about in the nearby mucky water. Her previous experiences with the strange creatures of this planet haven’t been all that pleasant of course, so she reached for her blaster pistol as well, pulling it free of its holster as she slowly moved away from her disabled spacecraft to investigate the noise.

She stopped at the edge of the water, but no matter where she looked, she couldn’t see anything out of the ordinary, or really anything distinguishable from the gloomy swampy environment she was stuck in. Just as Krystal was about to write it off as some kind of fish, she heard another splash, this one further away. She looked just in time to see the last of the water falling from the air and back into the mire, right next to another landmass on the other side of the swamp.

“Uggh, what am I doing..?” She wondered out loud before stepping into the water and traveling across the swamp.

At first the water only went up to her ankles, but soon enough it was up to her thighs. Thankfully the suit kept her completely dry, but it still felt disgusting wading through the filthy, silt-filled water. Once she reached the other side of the marsh, she climbed ashore and brushed the goopy mud off her legs and looked around once more for the source of the noise, pistol still in hand. While she was looking however, she heard another splash and a new noise, what sounded like a loud, low, gravelly groan, coming from her left. She turned towards it just in time to see what looked like a massive brown barnacle-like creature closing its shell, the groaning ceasing just as it did, its movements creating ripples in the water.

“How odd…” She mused, examining the creature from a distance. She’d seen many types of clams and mollusks in her travels. Most were small, though some, such as the ones on Sauria, could grow to be pretty big… Just not THIS big…Maybe this swamp was connected to one of the planets oceans? Or it could be that these things simply were adapted for freshwater.

As fascinating as it was though, she figured it would be best to just leave it alone now. Her curiosity was sated, but she didn’t want to risk this thing trying to eat her… hell, it was almost large enough to by the looks of it! As she began to walk away from the creature though she heard another one of their odd groans, though this one was much louder and much closer, coming from one of the things in the water right in front of her!

“H-Huh? How is that possible! I must have walked right past it!”

She debated trying to run past it before she heard even more groans, and as she looked over the marsh between her and her Arwing, she discovered that the trip back might be a lot more difficult. She must have woken them up with her first trip through the water, because now it was clear the place was absolutely full of the giant barnacles, all of them moving, groaning, and active.

Backing away from the edge of the swamp water slowly, Krystal weighed her options: She could either try to weave her way carefully around the barnacles and stay out of their reach… Or she’d have to find another way around them; a long detour to avoid something that she wasn’t even certain was dangerous.

Besides... who knows what else could be lurking deeper within the wilds..?
113321221111.title: Straying from the Ship

choices: Try to slip past the barnacles, hoping for the best!
Leave nothing to chance! Shoot the creatures just in case they try to attack.
1133212211111.content:
The vixen placed a hand on her hip as she finally decided: She was going to have to wade back through the swamp. Fox or Katt could show up at any minute to retrieve her, and if she went around the long way, she might miss them. She didn’t want to make either of them wait for her while she bumbled around the wilds trying to find her way back to the landing site, all because she got a little curious: She’d look like an idiot! Besides, there might be even worse things living further into the woods…

Still, looking out over the water and noticing almost a dozen of the strange, alien clam creatures, she let out a hesitant shiver. Sure, they could very well be harmless, but all the same they might not be… She’d seen stranger things before. But she had made up her mind already, and if she just sat here doing nothing, she’d just be wasting even more time! So, keeping her pistol out and at the ready, Krystal picked a part of the shore furthest away from any of the monstrous mollusks and waded in.

Several of the barnacles would open their shells and make those disturbing groaning noises as she passed close to them, but besides sending chills up the vixen’s spine, they did nothing to harm her. She figured she was either doing a good job keeping out of their range, or the things really were completely harmless, but as she looked ahead of her, she realized that she might find out which was the case soon enough.

Just as she was almost halfway through (And now waist-deep in) the water, she realized that she had run into a bit of a dead end. There was no longer any clear path through the alien barnacles now… in fact it seemed as though there were an even higher concentration of the creatures the closer she got to her Arwing. She did see an area ahead of her however that had less of them, but she would still need to pass dangerously close to at least one or two of them, and with the water so deep and thick with muck, it would be almost impossible to run by them quickly.

As far as Krystal could tell, there were only two options… She could either move past the barnacles, hoping that either she was still swift enough to avoid them or that they wouldn’t attack her… Or she could shoot the ones that lie directly in her path with her blaster pistol. It was a cruel option for creatures that might not even have defensive capabilities, but it just might save her life if they did.
1133212211111.title: Getting Close to the Barnacles

choices: Reach for the gun and shoot it!
Try to break free while you still can!
11332122111111.content:
Holstering her blaster pistol, Krystal steeled herself for what she needed to do next. She’d need to wade through the murky water as fast as possible if she wanted to avoid the barnacle-like creatures lurking in it, and she’d have to be ready. Taking a deep breath, Krystal clutched her paws into fists and leaped forward in a mad dash towards the shore!

…Or at least she tried to. Unfortunately for her, the suction from removing her boot from the mud coating the bottom of the marsh nearly caused her to trip. Thankfully she regained her balance, but now she had last all confidence in making it past the creatures before they could react. Maybe if she trudged slowly enough through the muck however, she might just be able to sneak by…

Carefully, Krystal walked through the marsh, making sure that each step she took through the water was slower and more calculated as she drew closer and closer to the barnacles. Before long though, she found herself right in the middle of a group of three of the things, and even though it appeared as though she was all but invisible to them, she noticed that her hands were still shaking quite a bit. She stopped momentarily, closing her eyes for just a moment in an attempt to calm her nerves.

Unfortunately for said nerves, they weren’t helped at all when the vixen’s ears picked up a the soft but sudden sound of rippling water, and she turned her head to see one of the barnacles to her right opening up its shell. Krystal gasped softly, worrying that even such a slight sound as that would aggravate it further. She stared at the creature as it opened up, revealing it’s soft, fleshy interior as it did, the vixen taking note in her terror of the odd, dark green color its insides possessed. After a moment, though it seemed much longer to the frightened woman, the creature simply let out one of its low, guttural groans before it slowly closed shut once again.

Krystal couldn’t help but laugh, more in relief than actual humor, “Wow, what was I worried about? These stupid things really are harmless!”

She snickered a bit more before continuing to walk forward, though as she was still looking at the barnacle to her right, she didn’t even notice the one in front of her until her knee collided with it and she tripped down into the water. She let out a yelp as she fell down towards the large barnacle, and instinctively reached out to grab onto something to stop her fall. Unfortunately for her, that happened to be the creature itself, and even more unfortunately, it didn’t seem to like that.

The strange, aquatic alien opened up its shell, spreading Krystals arms apart as she still clutched at it desperately. It then let out a noise, much like the groaning she was used to from them, but more shrill, almost sounding as though it were angry. The vixen would have gotten up, would have tried to get away from the thing, but she was far too petrified with fear to move even a single inch until it was too late. When the barnacle had finally opened fully, three thick, slimy tentacles shot into the air and lashed about, whipping and squirming blindly until they found their aggressor. Krystal screamed in absolute terror as the tentacles began to ensnare her, one wrapping about her left arm, another looping around her neck. The vixen gagged as this last one began to tighten and constrict her throat, reaching for it desperately to try to pull it off with her right hand before that too was restrained by the final tentacle.

She whimpered as she struggled against the creature’s grip as its rope-like appendages began to slowly drag her closer into its shell. What was it doing? Was it going to eat her?! Her mind raced with horrible thoughts and she panicked, kicking as her upper torso was pulled inside the shell, too terrified to even realize that the slime on the tentacles was actually eating away at her suit like acid. Warning icons flashed on her visor’s HUD indicating the breaches the monster was making in her suit, and she could feel the creature’s slimy flesh against her bare neck and arms. Her mind was filled with revulsion as she let out a choked howl.

She screamed and kicked more and more, even as the mollusk’s shell closed around her, and the moisture of the creature’s insides fogged up her helmet’s visor.

“You stupid, idiotic clam, let me go dammit!” She screamed and shouted as she pulled against the tentacles keeping her trapped, but soon they stopped pulling her deeper into the shell, letting her rump and legs dangle in the air outside.

For a moment all of the creature’s movements stopped, and even though its tight grip on the vixen’s throat still remained, she began to calm down a little. She tried to contemplate ideas now while she had the chance to think rationally, wondering if maybe she could slip her hands out of the tentacles wrapped around them, maybe even reach her pistol. She didn’t have long to think however, as she saw movement from the creature once more, obscured by her clouded visor, and panic began to overwhelm her once more. She kicked and struggled again, not certain of what was going on until something thumped hard against the glass of her helmet, and she let out a frightened shout.

Something was rubbing against the glass of her visor now, smearing a slimy residue all across its surface. The flashing warning lights and messages on the visor’s screen began to double before fizzling out as the visor itself began to melt away now, allowing the moist, warm, stinking air to flood into her helmet. Krystal gagged as she tried to hold her breath, still not knowing if the atmosphere was breathable, but the constricting tentacle around her neck made that incredibly difficult, forcing her to breath the air in through short breaths. As she finally saw the thing that had broken through her screen however, her mind was quickly brought to more urgent manners. It appeared to be another tentacle, though just a bit thicker than the others, and ever slimier. It reminded Krystal of the tongue of a snake, or maybe one of the Saurian species as it slowly wormed its way into her helmet.

“Oh no… What the fuck is THAT?” She groaned, gulping in dismay.

The vixen winced as she tried to pull her head away from the thing, but before she could the tentacle moved suddenly, shooting straight into her mouth and pushing down her throat. She gurgled against it, almost choking as it forced itself past her gag reflex and even further downwards. She tried to bite down on the damn thing, but it was just too big to manage enough force to: She simply didn’t have much room to bite with. She whined as the tentacle around her neck loosened a bit, and then the creature ceased all movement once more, the tentacle entering her body now firmly lodged inside and holding her still.

Just as Krystal was beginning to wonder just what the hell this thing was doing to her, she started to worry instead as the tentacle in her mouth started to squirm and her belly started to feel strangely heavy. Her eyes widened, her yelps muffled as she realized that her stomach was starting to swell against her suit. The barnacle was pumping her full of fluid!

She grunted and struggled once more, but this time it seemed as though it was working as the tentacles around her arms and neck slowly began to loosen. Desperately, she thought of what she could do next: Either she could try to reach for her gun and shoot the damn thing, or she could keep struggling and hope that she could break free.

As she felt her belly start to curve and become full, she knew her time was running out.
11332122111111.title: Getting Much, Much Closer to the Barnacles

choices: Eat some E-Rations. Might feel better after.
113321221111112.content:
As she struggled against the tentacle the creature continued to pump her with the unknown fluid. Her belly continued to grow with the stuff and started to round as she reached capacity. Her suit was getting tight around her middle and she wondered how much more she could take.

Just when she thought she may burst from the pumping and her stomach ached from the pressure, the creature stopped pumping her, but still held her in its grip. Her bell was quite obviously distended to anyone that may look at her, and she looked like she had swallowed a football! Krystal held her gut trying to rub the pain away when suddenly the pumping started again. But this time while her middle still grew with the fluid, the pain started to fadeaway and the feeling of fullness also left her gut.

In horrer krystal realized the tentacle was now pumping her with something that was causing her capacity to grow as much as her gut was growing!

“How much more is this thing gonna pump in me?!” she worried as her stomach grew larger and rounder.

Finally after what seemed like hours the beast stopped pumping fluid into her and started to lower her to the submerged ground. After which both the tentacle holding her, and in her mouth and stomach removed and released her to the ground.

Krystal tried to steady herself and regain her balance, both thrown off by the ordeal with the barnacle and her center of balance being thrown off by the weight of her unwanted liquid meal in her gut. She quickly backed away from the creature, and avoiding the others, not wanting to be pumped with anymore.

While she waded away from the creatures she kept caressing her belly, feeling how overstuffed it was, yet suffering from no pain or discomfort. Her belly was now a little bigger then a basketball, but felt like an underinflated water balloon. Her skin felt stretchier, and she didn’t feel full at all. In fact, she felt a little hungry. She worried a little about this as she was now pumped beyond her normal capacity.

As she wadded back to her ship her belly swayed a little back and forth as she moved through the brackish waters of the swamp.

“What do I do now?” she wondered, “What do I do about this stuff in me, and what effects should I expect from that strange creature? Why did it pump me full of this stuff and then let me go?”

Before she knew it she had made her way back to the shore containing her ship and dry land. She made her way out of the muck, and tried to clean herself as best as possible. While doing so she failed to notice that her belly had softened somewhat and its mass had shifted a bit lower. As if her belly had gotten fatter.

After cleaning the much off she started to feel a little hungrier. She looked down at her belly and thought, “you’ve got to be kidding. After all that and now I’m hungry?”
113321221111112.title: Try to break free while you still can!

choices: Go back to bed and hope all is a bad dream.
1133212211111122.content:
Krystal couldn’t fight the hunger off for long and went over to one of the storage compartments of the Arwing. Opening a panel she keyed in a short sequence of numbers and a larger compartment opened up. She removed both the emergency shelter and some of the E-Rations stored within and keyed the sequence to close the compartment. She carried the shelter a few yards from the ship and placed it on the driest part of ground she could find. Punching in a few commands on the shelter’s keypad she stepped back as the shelter began its self-building process.

After the shelter was finished erecting itself, Krystal stepped inside the first of four small rooms of the shelter with her food supplies from the ship. She placed the supplies on a small shelf near the inner door of the room and after checking the seals of both doors she removed what was left of her dissolved helmet and placed it on a storage hook. She them stepped in the small De-Tam shower and washed off any further contaminants still clinging from her suit. All the while steeling looks at the food and getting hungrier.

Once she was as clean as she felt she could get she picked up the supplies and entered the second room of the shelter. In the second and largest of the four rooms was a small cooking area, a sitting area for two-three people with foldout table, and light in the center of the ceiling, a small window to the outside, and three doorways. One went back to the de-contamination airlock, a second to a small sleeping pod, and a third to a small bathroom.

Krystal set down the supplies on a small shelf near the cooking stove and placed two E-Meals into the food reconstitute. The small stove was multi-purpose and could prepare E-Rations and another other foodstuffs procured while waiting for rescue.

While she waited she rubbed her belly in anticipation of the meals. Her belly had in this time gotten softer and more plush while she had been setting up camp. Something she still failed to notice due to her ever growing hunger. Soon the stove signaled it was finished and she removed the meals from the unit and sat down at the sitting area. She had to adjust the table from its normal position due to the new girth of her belly taking up more space than normal and proceeded to eat both meals ravenously.

After ten minutes she was scrapping the bottom of the second container and wanting more. Krystal with some difficulty got up from the small eating area and disregarding the warnings on the rations stating now to consume more then two rations a day due to the super hi calorie content for survival reasons, Krystal placed ten more rations in the stove unit for reconstitution. Once the unit was done Krystal brought the meals back to the eating area and chowed down.

The E-Rations were in fact designed to be quite large and high in calories for survival, and while small in the package to save space and pack more for long term durations in emergencies, once reconstituted were big enough for three meals a day. The instructions recommended on ration a day is not active, or two rations if under strenuous activity, but no more then two rations per day.

Krystal in her ravenous state brought on by the effects of the strange creatures liquid injection completely failed to remember her survival training and proceeded to tare through the ten additional meals. Also unknown to Krystal the fluid from the creature was intended to increase the stomach capacity of the individual and fatten up their belly area for as yet unknown reasons of the creatures.

As Krystal ate and ate, her belly grew and grew from the bulk of 6-12 days worth of food and the calories contained in the rations. Twice she had to adjust the table’s position due to her growing midsection. Once finished eating Krystal was finally satisfied and stifled a yawn. She was starting to get tired from carb overdose and the effects of the creatures fluid. She tried to get off the couch but had difficulty due to her increased girth. Finally after moving the table out of the way she was able to force herself to her feet. The meals and the creature had swollen her midsection to the size and weight of a medicine ball, albeit a squishy medicine ball. Luckily for her the suit she wore was designed to fit the wearer despite their size and shape. To a point. Unluckily for Krystal she was continuing to grow fatter as time, the goo and the rations continued to convert directly into belly fat.

Feeling tired and sluggish Krystal waddled her way to the sleeping-pod. She keyed the controls of the pod and the door slid back and allowed her access. Krystal folded down one of the two bunks and eased her way into a sitting position on the mattress. Her belly had swollen so large she had to open her legs to accommodate for the bulk of her gut. She idly patted and rubbed her stomach, her hands squishing into the new fat and the goo’s effects allowing her belly to stretch to accommodate the massive quantity of food and goo in her gut. She felt her belly fold and squish under her paws, but was so tired she didn’t fully register what the goo and her actions had done to her midsection.

Sleepily she yawned, “Ill feel better in the morning after some rest.” And with that Krystal laid down and soon was fast asleep. While she slept the goo continued to work converting her meal and itself into fat on her belly. Slowly her stomach grew larger and softer, bulging further forward and to her sides.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- ------------------------

The next morning Krystal woke from her food and goo coma sluggishly and tried to sit up on the bed. She had difficulty sitting up due to some sort of resistance. Once she managed to sit on the bed she found the reason.

“What the hell happened to me last night?!” Krystal almost yelled.

Looking down all she could see was her gut. She couldn’t even see the floor past her belly. Her belly had continued to grow during the night and had gotten quite large from the goo and her gorging that night before. It was so large that it pushed her legs wide in order to sit up and sagged over the edge of the bed. With difficulty Krystal got to her feet and made her way to the shelters small bathroom. Once she was in the bathroom she surveyed herself in the rooms full-wall mirror. Her couldn’t believe how big her belly had become.

Her belly was now three feet wide and three and a half feet deep. It was so wide that she couldn’t see her hips in the mirror unless she turned sideways, and sagged down over her crotch. She tried poking it with her finger and felt no resistance what so ever, her hand disappearing past her wrist. Placing both hands to either side of her gut Krystal lifted her belly up and let it fall, it bounced several times before coming to a rest. Her breast rested on top of her massive stomach which pushed them slightly to either side. Krystal undid her flight suit and let it fall to the floor. Despite how soft her belly had become, there were no fat folds to speak of, just one massive ball of flab. Her belly button was larger and disappear into the depths of her gut. Not wanting to see anymore Krystal struggle back into her flight suit, glad for the suits ability to stretch around its wearer.
1133212211111122.title: Make camp first for protection.

11332122111111222.content:
Once fully dressed again Krystal made her way back into the main room of the shelter confused and upset by her situation.

“What am I supposed to do now?” Krystal asked herself, sitting down on the couch. “How did this happen to me? I remember the encounter with those barnacles last night and then making my way back to camp. Then I…” her voice trailed off as the event’s of the night played back across her memory.

“DID I really eat that much? How is that even possible?” she asked herself as she ran her hands over her belly, her belly feeling like a beanbag chair full of soft gel.

Suddenly her gut rumbled, signaling that it was hungry for more food.

“Oh no! Not again! I couldn’t think of eating anymore! If this keeps up I won’t fit in the shelter, let alone the ship.” Krystal cried into her hands.

But her stomach wouldn’t quit, and she eventually found herself raiding the ship E-Rations again and bringing in even more supplies then the night before.

Krystal was so hungry she set the stove unit to prepare 30 rations, and once the machine was done took them to the table to scarf them down. Like the night before she ate and ate like a machine having to move the table out to the side and resting her current ration box on her growing gut. As she ate her belly grew larger and larger to accommodate for the massive amount of food she was consuming.

After consuming a month’s worth of rations Krystal sat back in the couch and rubbed her massive belly. Although her belly was stuffed bigger than the night before, she didn’t feel stuffed or at her stomachs limit. In fact, Krystal was hungrier than before, and her belly just continued to grow larger to fill with more food.

Beside herself with hunger, Krystal struggle to her feet and made even more hi carb E-Rations. This time she made 50 rations, each the equivalent to one day’s intake of a normal person waiting for rescue. Krystal took the rations back to the eating area and stacked most of them on the table to the side then sat down and put the rest on her belly for easier eating. The more she consumed the more her belly grew to accommodate the food entering her stomach. Her belly grew bigger and wider with every mouthful swallowed into her insatiable gut. The fat also grew with the influx of food, the food converting to fat half as fast as she ate. Krystal knew she should stop, but the hunger wouldn’t let her. Soon she had to sit on the floor as she grew too big for the couch, her belly growing bigger and wider across the floor.

Finally Krystal finished her month and a half rations and as she scraped the bottom of the last container she felt finally felt satisfied.

“What am I going to do?” Krystal panted, her belly resting heavily on her and the floor. “If this keeps up I won’t be able to leave the shelter when Fox finds me.”

Krystal looked at herself sitting on the floor with her back to the wall. Her belly was larger than anything she had ever seen. Yet despite her belly’s new girth and roundness, the rest of her hadn’t gotten any bigger. For some reason only her belly got fatter. Krystal carefully got to her feet, having to lean back due to her center of gravity being two feet forward of what it used to be. She cautiously made her way to the bathroom and its full room mirror. She had to squeeze through the doorway now that her belly was wide then the door frame, yet it was so squishy and stretchy that although more than a foot wider than the frame she had little difficulty getting in. Once in the room Krystal keyed the controls for the rooms biometric scanners to survey the damage.

She was now 5ft wide and 5 1/2ft deep in the middle. The scanners showed that 3/4 of today’s meals remained in her gut, and the rest had already converted into fat. The scanners also showed a strange gooie substance coating the inside of her stomach, and that her capacity for food had grown immensely. The coating of goo seemed to allow for her stomach to be much stretchier than normal and able to grow in size to accommodate larger feeding. Why this was so was still unknown.

Krystal ran her hands over her new gut, resting it on the small rooms sink for support. While feeling her new belly she felt something strange. Looking at the scanner readouts she saw what she feared. Her belly was getting larger, bulging further and further out. The goo was metabolizing the food at an alarming rate and her belly was fattening bigger and fatter as a result.

“No! Stop! I don’t want to be hungry again so soon! Or ever again!” Krystal yelled at her gut.
11332122111111222.title: Eat more rations

choices: The barnacles get to her first.
113321221111112222.content:
She squeezed through the doorway as fast as her gut would allow and made her way out of the shelter. She got stuck in the main entrance, which for some slight design flaw had been made smaller than the inside doorways, and forced her way out into the open. Once outside Krystal leaned against a tree to catch her breath. Moving this huge nuisance was…well…a nuisance. Then Krystal caught sight of her ship and its stored E-Rations.

“No.” she told herself, “I can eat any more.”

Krystal struggle with her control and her belly. Eventually her gut won out and she waddled to the nearby ship and its food stores.

Krystal broke out the ship food reconstitute and as many E-Rations as she could carry to the wing, than went back to the storage compartment for more. Each time she did she put them in the unit’s reconstituter and got more emptying out the freshly made meals and putting in more ration packs. Krystal finally sat on a stump that fortuitously was close to the wing and starting eating as fast as she could to keep up with the unit output.

As Krystal ate and ate her belly grow to accommodate the new food. Growing fatter, wider, bigger, and rounder. Her belly just kept bulging bigger and bigger as she ate more and more. Krystal kept eating, this time unable to satisfy her growing gut as it grew larger to hold all the food. She never could feel full and satisfied. While her belly grew larger the goo got back to work digesting as well as growing her stomachs capacity. Bigger and bigger she got., the bottom of her belly started to brush the ground as she sat on her stump eating the ration packs as fast as she could pull them out. every so often Krystal had to lean to her left to pull another create of E-Rations out of the ship and shove them into the reconstitute.

More and more Krystal ate, the more she consumed the bigger her belly became to hold it all, and the hungrier she got. She had set her suits bio scanner to continuously monitor her stats. Not that she was looking at them of course. As her belly continued to grow larger and fatter, the unit read her stats. She was packing on weight faster than any person should be able to. Fatter and fatter, bigger and bigger, larger and larger. Krystal just kept eating and growing.

Her belly was now touching the ground and pushing her legs farther and farther apart. Her belly began to spread under the ships wing, allowing her to stay in one spot now and continue eating. Tears ran down her cheeks as she kept going, unable to stop herself now. More and more food went into her belly, the goo growing her belly larger and larger to hold it all. Rounder and rounder her belly got. Finally, Krystal started to feel like she might be betting full. Her belly started to slow in its growing, and start protesting, yet she still couldn’t stop. Something drove her on.

“Why won’t it stop!?” Krystal sobbed between mouthfuls, her belly now larger than herself.

Just as she was starting the last container her hunger started to leave her. Her belly was now at its limit finally. Halfway through the container Krystal could eat no more. She put the unfinished food on the ship wing and tried to sit back, but her belly was wedged under the wing. Krystal was finally full, she couldn’t eat another bite. The goo that made her hunger for food had finally wore itself out. but the goo that converted her stomachs contence to fat was still there, coating her stomach and enhancing her metabolism.

As Krystal sat there. Relieved that she no longer had to eat, the goo started converting everything she just ate into belly fat. Her belly continued to grow ever larger, softer, wider. Krystal finally looked at the biometer and read the results. She was happy that the goo had finally burned itself out, but was concerned about how much bigger she was going to get due to all the food still in her gut.

“I really hope they find me soon.” Krystal thought to herself, “I think I ate all the food.”

Indeed she had, all three years worth of normal consumption.

Her belly gurgled as it grew larger. Krystal looked down at it for the first time since stopping. “I better move to a better place, or a my not be able to get out from under the wing. Krystal struggled to get up and pull herself free of the wing. She finally pulled herself free and sat down with her back to the ships hull. Al the while her belly continued to grow ever larger.

Krystal took stoke of herself. She looked at her wrist comp and read the biometer results. Her belly was now 10ft wide and still growing with soft yielding fat. Krystal rubbed what she could reach. Her belly was still incredibly soft, but she could now feel the stomach underneath was stuffed to capacity. A capacity she never would of thought she could attain, or wanted. Her belly just continued to grow fatter and fatter, still metabolizing at an alarming rate.

Krystal started to feel drowsy, unable to stay awake. Although she tried, Krystal finally fell asleep, unable to stay awake.

When she awoke she was shocked by two things.

1. She was huge. Her belly was easily twice as large as before she fell asleep.

2. She was not alone.

Just past the little shore she could just see over her bloated gut the barnacles that had caused this to happen to her.

In fear she watched them as they splashed feebly in the shallows of the swamp.

Krystal was immensely worried that they may pump her full of more goo, causing this all to happen again. She didn’t know if she could live through another session of eating and growing. Besides, she had consumed everything her ship had in the way of food rations. Krystal blanched a bit at this, disgusted with how much she had already consumed.

As she sat there, unable to move her 20ft wide belly of fat, she heard something in the sky, and a static burst on the ships radio.

Fox had found her! She only hoped they could get to her before the barnacles could ooze their way on land and pump her bigger.

She also hopped they brought a mega-lift with them!
113321221111112222.title: Get outside before you can't

choices: Oh, dear...  That's NOT an Arwing...
1133212211111122222.content:
Krystal turned her gaze skyward, hoping to catch a glimpse of Fox's Arwing as it would fly overhead. She could hear the roar of an engine, and the whoosh of wings as they sliced through the air. The radio continued to crackle, letting her know that help was on the way.

As minutes passed, though, without sight of the Arwing, the vixen began to grow frustrated.

"Where is he? Fox, you know I'm here..." the vixen snapped to herself. She sighed. "I guess... That it might be a bit hard to see. The skies look a bit foggy, definitely... And it is getting dark..." Patience returned to the bloated blue fox as she rationalized her savior's tardiness.

She took her eyes from the sky for a moment to steal a glance at the barnacles. They were... Keeping their distance, it seemed. While they continued to splash about, they seemed perfectly content to stay in the swamp. Did they know she was even there?

As the roar of the engine overhead intensified, the barnacles froze. Their tentacles stopped in mid-air, and for a few moments, didn't so much as twitch. After a few moments, they resumed animation, whipping about before shooting back into the body of the beasts. Their shells clamped shut, and the barnacles began to descend into the murky water.

"I guess they're scared... Ha!" With her foes having fled from her sight, she relaxed. Fox could take all of the time in the world, so long as the barnacles would stay away. The air was just as stagnant as it had always been, but Krystal had gotten used to it. It was obviously breathable, and as day gave way to night, it became pleasantly cool, lapping at her enormous fatty belly as the fox rubbed what little of it she could reach. She was... Content? Well, as content as one could be while being stranded on an unknown planet and being swollen to over fifty times your size. She was relatively comfortable, cool, and most importantly, not hungry. At least, not for now. She let her mind wander as she kept listening to the engines overhead and the crackling of her radio.

All of a sudden, the static buzzed into a low hum. The fox lazily turned her head toward her ship to hear better as a broken, garbled voice came through.

"Kr..." A single syllable, followed by a few more. "... Ul. Kr... St... Uh... Co..."

It sounded like her name, a bit. But she didn't recognize the voice; it certainly didn't sound like any of her crew-mates. She could chalk that up to a poor signal, but...

For the first time since she heard the engines in the sky, she entertained the notion that... It might not be Fox's Arwing that she'd been hearing all this time. Paranoia washed over her. If it wasn't Fox... Who was it?

"It's gotta be Fox... This planet... There's nobody on this planet. We never heard any signals from any other ships, here, and we would have when we scanned the planet before we entered the atmosphere! There's nobody here..." she said to herself. She wasn't quite sure she believed herself, though. The scanners said there wasn't any intelligent life, but... They could be wrong.

"But... The radio! I wouldn't be hearing anyone on the radio unless they had my frequency! And the only people who have my frequency are Fox and Katt!.. Yeah..." But what if her frequency had been "hacked?"

She sighed nervously as the sound of engines grew ever louder and the silhouette of a spacecraft appeared overhead. It was vaguely triangular, like an Arwing, but she couldn't make out any of the finer features of the body, or even its color.

She gulped as the shape flew overhead, growing larger as it descended from the sky but still remaining obscured by the misty sky and absence of light. She couldn't move in this state; she was trapped by her enormous belly, which pinned the rest of her body against her ship. She couldn't flee, and she was sure that, even if she couldn't see the ship, it could definitely see her. How could it miss a 20-foot-wide blob next to a downed spacecraft?

She was a sitting duck, plain and simple. She could only hope that the ship above belonged to Fox, because if it didn't, her goose was cooked...
1133212211111122222.title: Rescue..?

11332122111111222222.content:
Krystal looked on as the black figure descended from the sky, coming into view. She could make out some of its features, now, as it began to circle overhead. It was flying pretty fast... Faster than an Arwing would normally fly. Not a good sign...

As fast as it was going, she could only make out its coloring... Black, yellow and red. No blue or gray to be seen anywhere. The blue vixen hoped she was going colorblind, because otherwise, this was not an Arwing. As it began to slow, she could make out some of its parts...

The wings were a good deal thicker than she'd remembered an Arwing's wings being, a bit longer, and curved upwards.

The prow of the ship's hull ended in some hooked ornamentation... That's new.

And the ship lacked any sort of cannons, save for one mounted on the below the cockpit on the ship's underside, which almost looked like... A harpoon gun.

Abject horror overtook the fattened blue fox as it became clear that, without the shadow of a doubt, this was, positively, not an Arwing (nor would it be a ship belonging to a colonist), and pretty clear that that was not Fox, nor would it be any of the missing colonists she was sent to find. And while she couldn't say for certain, the vixen was pretty sure that it wasn't friendly.

The menacing ship flew in lazy circles overhead for what felt like hours to Krystal. Could it see her? I mean, you'd think it would, but... Maybe it couldn't, through all of the fog and darkness. But why would it keep circling if it didn't see her? What was it doing?

The fox held her breath, hoping that it'd leave soon, that it hadn't detected her. She'd be as quiet as possible, and it wouldn't hear her... She hoped.

At the exact wrong moment, her stomach began to rumble. Loudly. The vixen froze in fear as her belly began to quake and jiggle, quickly expanding before her as it's rumble grew louder. It surged across the ground in front of her, and with this last expansion, her suit finally gave, dramatically ripping open and spilling the now-unrestrained belly across the ground. The ship stopped in midair... And a searchlight shone down from the mounted gun, rolling along the ground. Mercifully, her belly went quiet and still, but she was sure it was too late...

But maybe it wasn't! The searchlight was out, sure, but it hadn't caught her yet! Maybe it'll get bored and--

BEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEELCH

The vixen blushed as her mouth flew open to release a plume of foul-smelling red gas. She belched again, and more gas filled the air. It seemed to just linger around her, almost clinging to her as she kept releasing bulk-quivering bursts of gas from her mouth.

The searchlight darted from its position next to a tree straight over to her and the Arwing. The vixen, like a deer in the proverbial headlights, could only stare into the light as it lingered on her, the entire gun-mount facing her. At the back of her mind, aside from the fear, she felt great shame, imagining how ridiculous she looked, a gassy, half-naked blue blob of fat jiggling helplessly against her downed Arwing... But, back to the fear.

The "harpoon" in the gun began to spin within its barrel as a small blinking light flashed next to it. She watched in horror as the weapon continued to "prepare" itself, awash in horrible anticipation of its inevitable launch. She didn't have long to wait, though, as before she could even think of reacting (which she obviously couldn't, anyway), the "harpoon" shot out of the barrel, rocketing towards her and piercing the middle of her gut. She began to scream, but stopped when she realized that she had barely even felt the missile strike her flesh. Did it have a numbing agent in it? Or was her gut simply numb, itself? She took the moment to examine what little of it she could as the ship flew away, presumably to find a suitable spot to land.

It was built like a syringe, it seemed. She could see a gauge on the missile, and a plunger on its tail, accompanied by a large flashing light. Her belly tingled as the plunger depressed, and she was injected with whatever was inside of the canister. Her entire belly was overcome by a burning sensation as it began to quiver violently... And shrink. She could feel the fat in her gut start to thicken, and she could feel much of it... Migrating?

Yes, the fat seemed to be distributing itself around her body. Her belly shrank, but everything else grew. Her breasts swelled with new flesh, surging forward to meet the receding horizon of her belly, which lost its spherical shape and became a more "natural" collection of folds and bulges crowned with a cavernous navel. Her thighs thickened, pressing into each other and spreading her legs apart as the fought for space. Her hips, not to be outdone, flared out from her sides, swelling into ever-fuller curves. Her ass exploded outward, rolling across the ground beneath her, spreading to fill her body's new width. Her calves and arms weren't spared, either, as they too ballooned, swallowing her paws in flab and leaving only dimples suggesting where they might be buried. And to "round" this all out, numerous rolls of back-fat grew from behind her, giving her a cushion between her body and the hard, cold metal of the Arwing. The transformation completed with her face, with a surprisingly-modest second chin forming beneath her first one, and some cherubic jowls.

Krystal could hardly believe what had just happened. Only a couple of minutes ago, there was over 30 feet of belly-fat spread out in front of her... Now, she was left with a "modest" 5 feet of belly, and 5 feet of back-fat, and 10 feet from side-to-side. The burning sensation subsided, being replaced by the natural warmth of what must be over a ton and a half of blue vixen. The fox panted as she was overwhelmed by the stifling heat. Rivulets of sweat formed all over her body as the cool night air became inadequate in keeping her cool, sliding down her bloated form and getting caught in her folds. She shuddered to think of how difficult it would be to keep herself clean and fresh, but that was the least of her worries right now.

What was presumably the pilot of the attacking ship came into view out of the brush... A ten-foot-tall, bipedal dragonoid creature, staring at her with malicious intent as he strolled toward his "prey." She could see that it was smiling; a wicked, toothy grin. Lots of teeth. Sharp teeth...

Krystal could only hope that it wasn't as carnivorous as it looked...
11332122111111222222.title: Definitely NOT Rescue...

113322.content: Who will she go with?
113322.title: She goes with Fox/Katt.

choices: Both Katt and krystal began to gain weight by the tons!
They grew, but more in the "womanly" areas
1133222.content: "Ok Katt, ome on. It takes two to explore a planet," said Krystal. "Well," Katt said, "Are you sure you can leave Fox here?""He'll be fine, won't you, Fox?" asked Krystal. "What, you think I need a night light?" said Fox. "That's like trying to get Panther, Falco, and Wolf to have an orgy." He gagged as he said it, stopping when he saw how serious Krystal and Katt were. They walked away, shaking their heads. They walked for a few miles, and found a strange bush with fruit. Without thinking, Katt reached out, plucked one off, and ate it. "Katt!" said Krystal, "What are you doing! That could be poisonous!" Katt started to gag, trying to get the fruit out. However, she suddenly felt a huge amount of weight on her entire body. Without control of her actions, Katt grabbed another fruit and shoved it in Krystal's mouth. After she was forced to swallow it, Krystal gagged herself, feeling the intense weight too. Suddenly...
1133222.title: Katt has some issues

114.content: As Krystal gains weight, certain body parts get bigger than the rest. Which do you want to expand?
114.title: weight gain and expansion

choices: Use that weight gain gun of Slippy's.
1141.content: It has been several months since Krystal and Fox's last adventure and the pair have been spending much time together. Krystal wakes up one morning, yawns, and gets out of bed. She walks over to her floor length mirror and looks herself over. Her formerly trim, yet curvy, figure was starting to fill out causing her nightie to grow snug. She sighs and rubs both hands over her plump hips, up her softening sides, and caresses her round middle. Krystal looks down at her breasts, which have grown even more noticeably then the rest of her body, a full three or four cups. She sighs again. "I hope Fox hasn't noticed all the weight I've packed on recently." Her hands roam up to her breasts, tightly packed into the top of her nightie, and starts fondling them. She grins and gives a quiet moan of pleasure. "At least he will like these being bigger." "Actually, I like all of you being bigger." Comes Fox's voice from behind her, as he reaches around her softening belly. He starts rubbing her gut in unison with her fondling. Her belly starts jiggling slightly as she turns her head and nuzzles him on the cheek. "Thanks Fox. You sure do know how to make a growing girl feel beautiful." Fox chuckles and kisses her on the lips. "How about we make you larger?" Krystal gasps. "You want me larger Fox?" "Yes. You look good now, but you could look even better." She ponders for a few mintues. "Ok Fox. Make me you big, flabby, love vixen!" He smiles at her request. "Ok my love. How do you want to get larger?"
1141.title: A growing Krystal.

choices: French Toast, Sausages, and a Vanilla Milkshake!
11411.content:
"Well, I suppose we can give tried-and-true a shot." said the plump, blue Krystal while she took a hold of Fox's hand and placed it over her stomach, directly under her fattened left breast. An audible growl came from said stomach. "What do you think, my Reynard?" Krystal continued in a sultry tone, also moving her lover's hand up to her breast and making him squeeze it.
Fox, after recovering from Krystal's teasing, managed to say: "Um, Krystal, just eating would take forever to put on weight, why not-"
Krystal couldn't help but giggle at Fox's almost child-like answer: "Oh Foxxy, don't you think good things should be savored?" The she-fox took her man's other hand and cupped her right breast, letting own and sensual sigh. (Clearly, she enjoying this whole situation maybe a bit much)
"Okay, when you put it that way..." a more ravenous Fox uttered, spinning his voluptuous, sapphire vixen around and locked lips.
