1153121.content:
Krystal sighed as she stepped down from her ship. She was out exploring this uncharted region of space, and had started to run low on supplies. She could have made a jump back to a more civilized region in order to restock, but her ship had gotten gotten some readings from this planet that warranted some investigation.

She looked around, quite taken by the splendor of this world. She had set down at the edge of a wide plain, filled with some type of blue grass that came up to her waist. A distant mountain range seemed to made from some form of green stone, though it was hard to tell with how the suns were casting their light. Behind her, a dense forest stretched on, filled with tall trees all capped with blue canopies, thick with leaves.

She got a slight feeling of surprise and maybe excitement from somewhere, but couldn't pin down the exact location. Looking around closer didn't reveal the source either. Reaching back into the ship, she grabbed a field pack, containing some basic gear she might need, including some of her last remaining rations. Hiking the pack onto her shoulders, she grabbed a small hand scanner, waved it around, and was able to locate a nearby source of water. Sealing the ship down, she shifted her jumpsuit around to avoid rubbing her fur the wrong way, and set off. While keeping an eye on the scanner to tell if she was going the right way, as well as keeping her other senses tuned to detect any possible threats, she moved into the forest.
1153121.title: Mystery world

choices: She decides to check out the building, see if she can find the water source.
She checks out the water closer to the structure, not wanting to go in just yet.
11531211.content:
It was surprisingly easy goings, Krystal found. The forest didn't have a lot of the ultra-thick undergrowth as some other worlds. She couldn't stop having the feeling she was being watched, but could see no sign of who or what it was, neither with her own senses or that of her hand scanner. Quickly moving through the forest, she was able to find her way to the water, actually a wide fast flowing river. She was surprised by the condition of it, though considering what she saw of the world, she might not have been. Rather than the typical clear water she was used to, this river had a distinctly purple hue.

She could see signs of animal activity in the muddy river banks, as well as what seemed to be fruit bearing plants clustered around the water. So the water seemed to be fine for the things on the planet, but she had no idea if it would work for herself. Even repeated scans from her scanner found nothing wrong with the water, but also no explanation for the color. Looking around, she thought that maybe the water was just picking up something in the ground that was giving it that color, maybe it might be clear closer to the source. After watching the flow of the river, she could tell which way it was coming from, and set off in that direction. Unseen by her, some of the branches in a tree above her moved, as if something had jumped off to another one.

As she walked along, waving the scanner around to get some more readings that she could, she pulled out one of her last water bottles. It was warm, but at least it was wet, and she knew what was in it, unlike that river water. As she put the bottle away,she didn't realize that she had walked straight into a large clearing. After the dappled blue light within the forest, coming right out into the sunlight blinded her momentarily blinded her. Blinking her eyes to clear the spots, as well as bringing her arm up to take some of the glare off, she looked around as best she could. Slowly features could start to be picked out, the clearing was almost entirely devoid of trees, just a few short ones here and there. There were also a number of stone pieces around, too well formed to be natural, but not all that well maintained, they were cracked and broken, dirty looking, laying in the grass of the clearing. The seemed to be arrayed around the remains of a path, now nearly overgrown with the native grass. Dominating the clearing was a large structure, seemingly made out of carved sections of the same white stone, but seemingly much better maintained, quite bright in the sunlight. The river also seemed to spill from within the wide doorway to the structure, no less purple than when she found it before. The path seemed to lead up along one side of the river, up into the yawning darkness within the building.
11531211.title: Welcome to the forest

choices: The calling is too great, and she touches the glowing statue.
She snaps out of it, snatching her hand back and looking away.
115312111.content:
Krystal passed the scanner around again, checking to see if it would pick up anything. Unsurprisingly, it didn't, no small wonder since it couldn't even figure out what was up with the water. She quietly stepped up the remains of the path, using the stone pieces as cover. The darkness within hid the inside completely, right up to when she finally reached the massive stone that formed one side of the entryway. There she could finally make out a bit of the interior.

The river seemed to flow through a large stone trough, much narrower than what the river had cut out of the ground within the forest. Sunlight streamed through a large hole in the ceiling, illuminating a large platform in the middle of an empty chamber. Stepping inside, Krystal was caught by the drop in temperature, it seemed like it had dropped something like ten degrees from the temperate conditions outside. A quick check of the scanner confirmed that she was right. Thankful for her jumpsuit and fur, she continued moving in. The walls were covered in long chains of some alien script or pictograms, it was hard for her to tell, and something seemed to be giving a glow from a pedestal on the platform.

Stepping closer, Krystal could see that the platform was circular and flat, The same purple water she had been following seemed to flow from all points around the platform before flowing on out of the structure, A number of small stone bridges connected that central platform with the rest of the chamber's floor. She still couldn't tell what the object was in the center of the room, but she felt drawn towards it. Checking around again, she then proceeded across the nearest bridge to the center. Finally back within the light from above, she could see what the whole room seemed to be arrayed around.

Atop the pedestal was a statue maybe 2 feet tall. It seemed to be made of a clear crystal, but it radiated a light from within. As Krystal watched, the light seemed to twinkle and shift through various colors, it even gave off an aura of energy and warmth. Spinning in place, she looked around the room, thinking that the whole place seemed to be a temple devoted to this statue. Turning back to face it, Krystal moved a bit closer to get a better look. The statue seemed to be of a person, but like no person she had ever seen before. The decidedly female figure had four arms, and a vulpine like face. The oddest part was that figure was bloated out in all directions, swollen beyond compare. The stomach of the figure was a huge round orb stretching out from the body, and resting on the stone of it's pedestal. Huge breasts sat heavily upon the swollen stomach, and might have been spherical if not for setting atop that larger sphere. The arms were swathed in flesh, and looked like they wouldn't be able to move far. Broodmother sized hips and a tremendous butt likely served as a bit of a counterweight to the figure's bust and belly. Even the face was dripping with weight, but it had a maternal care and shape to it.

Stepping back, Krystal looked around again, but her eyes kept getting drawn back to the statue and it's light. At this range, she could almost swear that it was calling out to her, like a voice she could barely hear. Her fingers twitched, and she started to put her hand towards the statue, feeling a slight tingle reaching up her arm as she got closer and closer.
115312111.title: Moving within

choices: She is suddenly left feeling ravenous, leaving her far too weak to try anything.
Whatever the statue did, she has been left bloated up.
1153121111.content:
Her fingers gave another twitch as she paused for a moment, then pushed her hand a little bit further till her hand was resting on the smooth crystal. As she did so,her whole body surged with energy, every muscle in her body locked up. The light from the statue grew blindingly bright, washing everything away in it's brilliance. The tingle that she had felt before was now spread through her whole body, only much stronger. The warmth from the statue started to move up her arm, flowing through her body and washing the chill of the room away. The warmth continued to grow, till Krystal thought she might just burst into flame.The feeling seemed to be especially centered around her stomach, feeling like there was a fire burning away within, yet no pain came from the heat. As quickly as this had started, it ended, the room being cast into darkness, and she slumped over into unconscious.

Krystal then awake some time latter, foggy headed and sore. Her head throbbed, and her body ached. Slowly she was able to piece together some of her sensations. It hurt to try opening her eyes, so she didn't for now. She could feel the cold stone beneath her, so she was laying on her back...what had happened to her pack, she didn't remember taking it off. Unable to come up with an idea, she let it pass for now, too much thinking made her head hurt worse. She didn't actually feel cold though, if anything she felt like she was overly warm. Slowly she was able to make out a noise, soft whispers and a padding noise, almost like...bare feet stepping across the stone. Too many to be just one from the sound of things. Trying her eyes again, they responded a bit better. Everything was blurry, but she could start to make out some things. Like how the room was mostly cast in darkness, no sun in the sky, maybe a little dull moonlight coming through the hole instead. Had she really been out till nightfall? Blinking her eyes a couple times, she could make out figures walking around the platform in the room. Blinking her eyes several more times helped bring them into focus. Moving around near her were about 6 vulpine figures, all covered in short deep blue fur. Then she saw something else, all of them had four arms, much like that statue.

The statue! A piece clicked in her brain as some of her memories recovered, and she looked around, eventually finding it still atop the pedestal. The glow seemed dimmer, but still remained illuminating the curves carved into the crystal. Her headache seemed to be passing, but now she was left surrounded by at least 6 of these people, likely a native population to the world. Not a lot of options she had left. She found her pack to one side, with one of the natives going through it, not much she could do there. No way she could even try fighting her way out, not in her condition. Not coming up with anything else, she tried sitting up.
1153121111.title: A power within

choices: Unthinkingly, she moves to her pack and tears into the rations.
One of the natives pulls something out a belt pouch and gives it to her.
11531211111.content:
As she tried to sit up, it was like a switch flipped. A great gnawing hunger seemed to open up within, causing her to flop back down with a growl as her stomach cramped. At the sound of her falling back, her growl, or maybe even the hungry roar issuing from her stomach, the native that was inspecting her pack turned around and stared at her. He gave a short bark in their language, and now all of the natives were be looking straight at her. Her whole body was left drained, yet still felt strangely warm, leaving her lying there for whatever they wanted to do.

What they wanted to do was form a loose circle with all 6 of them surrounding her, Then as one, they knelt down to one knee, and laid their torsos across their upright legs, seemingly bowing towards her. Being so much closer, and her hunger abating somewhat, she was able to get a closer look at them. All of them had the blue fur and four arms, as well as two tails she noted. She also noticed that all 6 of them were males, or at least they certainly looked it. The 6 were bare chested, and wore what looked like some type of hide pants. All of them carried at least one spear, a much more muscular one carried two larger spears, while the tallest one also had a longbow strung across his body. The one who was going through her pack leaned up, the leader she thought judging from the more complex and ornate piece on his spear, still on his knee and looked at her.

He spoke to her in his language, and though she couldn't understand it, it seemed to be maddeningly familiar. It seemed to be a question from his tone, but she couldn't be sure, and had no way to answer either.

She tried the best she could though, "I'm sorry, but I don't understand." Trying to put as even a tone to her voice so they might not think she was insulting them.

The leader seemed to ponder this, then gave what seemed like an order to the rest of them. There seemed to be some excitement to their words at that, talking back and forth, then two of them got up and walked away, towards the doorway. Two of the others, the one with the bow and another, came closer and leaned over her. They stopped just before touching her, and looked into her face. It almost seemed like they were asking if it was okay for them to help her up. Krystal nodded, hoping that it might mean about the same thing to them as she thought. It must have because they tenderly grabbed her arms and helped her stand.

Now standing, she saw a movement of light that didn't seem to come from the environment. She also realized that was was naked except for her fur, no sign of her jumpsuit at all. Did something happen to it when she touched the statue, or did these people do something to it while she was out? She felt embarrassed to be before them naked like this, and did as best she could to cover up with her hands and tail. Another wave of hunger caused her to hold her stomach, such concerns forgotten, and as she did so she saw the light shift. After the wave subsided a bit, she held her hand out a bit and saw the light shifting around. Looking down over her breasts, she saw that some symbol was now across her stomach, emitting the same light that statue did. Another wave of hunger caused her to cramp up, the two nearest moving to catch her. This hunger pang seemed worse than the last ones.
11531211111.title: This is different

choices: They get interrupted along the way.
115312111111.content:
The hunger pain continued, gnawing away within her. She was able to bring her head up enough to look at her pack, still laying where the leader had left it. Stumbling straight at it, she went right for the rations still inside. Tearing the foil packaging with her teeth, she dove right into the pouches. The bland but nutritionally dense foodstuffs was quickly stuffed down her throat. Grabbing one of the water bottles, she flipped the top off and guzzled it, helping to move the dry food down into her stomach. Another two pouches were quickly torn open and emptied just as quickly, followed by another bottle of water. Partway through a fourth ration, she was finally able to gain control of herself again. Looking down at the shredded packaging surrounding her, as well as the partially eaten one in her hand, she realized that she had eaten enough food that should have lasted her at least a week, and yet it had only taken a few minutes, and she still felt hungry. All of that food had only taken the edge off.

Feeling like she was being watched, she turned and saw the natives staring at her. It was hard to tell, but she thought they might actually look amazed at what she had done. The leader gave another small command with a hand motion, and the one with the bow stepped forwards. Krystal was feeling a little better, and was able to stand on her own, if a little shakily. Nodding, he instead picked up her pack and after looking at the detritus, picked it up and shoved it into her pack as well. She remained with the open pouch of food, and continued to nibble on it, seemingly helping her hunger just a bit. The leader and the one with two spears then started walking towards the doorway, with the bowman motioning for her to follow them. The last one brought up the rear, still looking around the room, and back at the statue.

As they passed over the bridge, Krystal saw her reflection in the water surrounding the platform. Moving closer, she was able to see the symbol across her stomach more clearly. The shimmering water and shifting colors of the symbol made it a bit harder to make out, but from what she could tell it was a circular symbol with two parallel lines cutting down across it, centered around her navel. A single shorter line connected the tops of the two vertical lines. Thinking it looked familiar, she looked up at the script on the walls, there it was, and again, and again, and so on. The symbol was repeated many times across the walls, and that was just in the small area she could see in the moonlight.

The natives waited patiently for her till she was ready. Still unable to make heads or tails of anything, Krystal gave up on that, and take a few steps forwards. They figured that she was ready to move again, so they set off. Outside, the two that were sent ahead waited till all of them exited, then they quickly bolted off for the tree line. Once there, they took a huge jump, landing halfway up the trees, another and they vanished into the thick foliage of the canopy. The group around Krystal made for the same area, though much slower to allow her to keep up. Within the forest, it was nearly pitch black with little light coming through the canopy. The natives seemed to know exactly where to go, and Krystal had no other idea, so she followed right along.
115312111111.title: Feeding time

choices: They have taken Krystal to a large village.
They have brought Krystal to a small camp.
1153121111111.content:
Krystal merely followed along, being led wherever the natives chose. She nibbled on the remains of the ration pack, but her gnawing hunger didn't allow her much choice but to eat it on top of the other 3 she had eaten. Her stomach still felt empty despite all of the food she had already eaten. A distant peal of thunder could be heard echoing through the forest, while a cool breezes weaved it's way through the trees. Krystal shivered a bit as the breeze ruffled her bare fur. Seeing this, the bowman following behind her said something to the leader, who looked back at her. Responding to the archer, he gave a hand signal to his fellows, and all of them set off a bit faster.

"Hopefully we're going somewhere a bit warmer, and somewhere with clothes for me." She thought to herself as she tried to keep up.

She was inexperienced in this forest though, and her feet seemed to find every exposed tree root or slippery rock they could. The archer was always quick to catch her and help her stand so they could continue. The sound of the thunder continued to get closer, while the breeze grew in intensity. Before long, Krystal was able to hear rushing water, and the babble of voices. Up ahead, she could see hints of light through the thick tree trunks. A few moments later, the party passed into a clearing in the woods, just as some fat raindrops started to fall.
1153121111111.title: Uneventful journey.

choices: Entering the buliding, there is a single woman, another of their species.
Inside the building, there is a gathering of their species.
11531211111111.content:
There, deep in the forest, was a stone wall with a gate. When they passed through the gate, Krystal could see that it was a large village, populated by the same people that had found her in the temple. There seemed to be quite a gathering of the blue four armed foxes as they walked down the main path. Krystal saw more of the males, most looking trim as the hunters or scouts that she had been traveling with. The females she saw were quite different; all of those she could see tended to be at least plump, while some were downright fat. More than a few of them tended to have much larger rounder stomachs their weight would suggest.

"Perhaps they're pregnant." Krystal wondered to herself.

She also grew more self conscious, trying her best to cover up body up with her hands and tail. Though none of them seemed to have too much a problem with her bare fur covered body. The rain was starting to fall more heavily, so the people tended to congregate under shelter as they watched Krystal go by. She noticed that the village seemed to be laid out in a circle, most of the buildings surrounding a center section. The rushing water that she heard turned out to be a river, perhaps the same river that she had found and led to the temple, flowing into a pool in the middle of the village.

Standing in the center was quite a sight: a much larger version of the statue that she had found in the temple, carved out of stone a bit more roughly, but the design was unmistakable. Lit by a ring of roughly hewn glowing crystals, seemingly much like what the small statue was made out of, the statue rose above the center pool with much the same dimensions as it's smaller version, just on a much larger scale. Seeing the statue like that, Krystal could only think of the words Earth Mother to describe it. As she looked a little closer, she saw the same symbol carved on the statue's massive belly as was on her stomach and around the temple. Perhaps the symbol was even on the small crystal statue, but it was hard to tell because of the smaller size and the glow from within.

The four that helped her through the forest waited patiently for her. The one at the rear kept looking back and forth between the stone statue and Krystal, though she was too entranced to notice. When she had recovered, the leader said a few words to the others. They allow gave what seemed to be a salute or something, clasping their four hands in front of their chests and bowing their heads slightly. Then they separated and went on their ways. Left with just the leader, Krystal looked up at him. He pointed ahead to a building nearest the statue, and started walking towards it. She dutiful followed behind, not having any other ideas, especially in the middle of such a number of them.
11531211111111.title: Into the native village

choices: She pulled one of the amulets off of her neck and gave it to Krystal.
She stood up and started to mix various things from the selves in a bowl.
115312111111111.content:
The leader pulled back the curtain covering the doorway, and motioned for Krystal to enter. She cautiously stepped inside, and he followed. The room looked like where a shaman might do their business, shelves with various powders and other small ingredients in bowls or jars, a stone copy of the same statue sitting in a place of honor in the center of the back of the room, the whole place softly lit with another of the roughly carved glowing crystal hanging in the middle as well as a few candles dotted around. The leader gave a soft call, and a feminine voice answered from a doorway in the back of the room. The curtain slid back and a fox woman stepped out, likely the answering voice's owner.

She took a look around but took a startled jump when her eyes fell on Krystal. Looking up at the male, the female fired off some fast words with a wide surprised look in her eyes. The male seemed to answer her, and continued at some length. The female sat down on a cushion on the rug in the center of the room, right in front of the altar, she motioned for Krystal to sit in front of her on a similar cushion, and she slowly did so, still completely lost on what they were saying, but had some feeling they were talking about her.

Since it looked like she had some time, Krystal took a moment to more closely examine the woman. Like the others, she had the blue fur, four arms, and two tails. Like the females that Krystal had seen in the village, this one was definitely more round than the males she had seen in the village, but she was even more so than the other females. Her round stomach looked to be around eight to nine months along with at least 3 children, but was still covered in a soft layer of fat. Her breasts were somewhat spherical despite their obvious weight, and sat heavily atop her stomach, Her face was round, and had a maternal feel to it. Her neck sloped into her soft shoulders, which led into her arms. There was quite a layer of fat to her arms, but there was muscle somewhat visible under the flab as well. The woman's butt was just as soft from what Krystal saw when she came in. Her hips were wide and well muscled even under the layer of fat covering them, and her calves had slightly more easily seen muscles. Her long black hair was braided with various little charms hanging from the cordage. A number of amulets hung from bands around her neck, plunging into the shadow of her cleavage. Beaded cords wrapped around her neck and looped under her breasts, likely to connect to the neck piece in the back. A similar beaded belt started near the bottom curve of her stomach and likely continued underneath, with a leather section hanging loosely in the front, now behind her legs.

The woman seemed to realize that Krystal was looking at her, so she turned her attention back to Krystal. Realizing that she had been caught staring, Krystal looked away quickly. Glancing back though, she realized the woman seemed to be observing her just the same, though her eyes were especially drawn to the glowing symbol on Krystal's stomach. The leader had finished his story it seemed, and the woman, a wise woman of this tribe (all for lack of better words on Krystal's part) considered this then said a few words to him. The male gave the same salute as the other males that helped Krystal, clasping his four hands in front of his chest and bowing his head. He held this pose for longer and backed out the door without looking up. As the curtain fell back into place, Krystal could see him looking at her before he was out of sight.

Turning back to the woman, Krystal didn't know what else to do except wait. The woman looked at her thoughtfully for a while before saying a few words.

Still unable to understand, "I'm sorry, but I don't understand you," trying to keep her voice level and slow to try and avoid any misinterpretation from the tone. The woman seemed to consider this, looking down at the marking on Krystal's stomach, then she seemed to have an idea.
115312111111111.title: The wise woman

choices: First clothes, then food, got to handle her hunger.
They get interrupted when Krystal starts to grow.
1153121111111111.content:
The wise woman seemed to consider this for a moment, looking at the symbol on Krystal’s stomach, then she appeared to have an idea. Reaching down and pulling off one of her amulets, she offered it to Krystal. Krystal slowly reached out and took it before examining the necklace. It was a deep blue stone with the same symbol as the statues carved on it, hung on a leather cord with similar smaller blue stones arranged on the band. The woman went through the motions as if she was putting it on, making it obvious that she wanted Krystal to do so. She shrugged and turned it over before slipping it over her head. Looking down at the stone, Krystal thought she saw a shimmer within it, but she couldn’t be sure because at that moment a bright flash and noise rattled her whole head.

Her head felt foggy and slow like before, she was having this happen too often for her liking. Blinking her eyes several times, she found that she was still sitting on the floor across from the woman. The woman on the other hand was still sitting as if nothing had happened, and maybe whatever it was had just happened to Krystal.

A voice shocked Krystal, coming from the woman, but she could understand it,” Can you understand me now?”

Krystal could hear her speaking in their language, but she was able to understand it just as well as if she had always known it. Even more surprising was how she answered in their language, “Yes…but how…?”

The woman gave a little laugh before answering, “My my, that worked even better than I thought. That amulet has been passed down for generations, it was said to bring understanding, and it certainly seemed to have worked for you. You may call me Shiara, and what may I call you.”

Krystal was still fuddled, but recovered enough to answer, “Krystal, my name is Krystal.”

“Ah, Krystal, may I be the first the welcome you to our village, or at least the first one you can understand. It is very nice to meet you,” Shiara said bowing her head respectfully.

Krystal was about what had happened to her, but was interrupted by a roar from her stomach; she had almost entirely forgotten about her hunger from before.

“Oh, my apologies, I suspected this would happen. Will you please join me?” Shiara said standing up, and help Krystal stand despite her own size.

“Join you?” Krystal managed to say despite the protests of her stomach gnawing away.

“Why yes, at the feast in your honor,” Shiara responded, “but first, we better get you some clothes, you were awfully chilled after coming through the forest.”

Krystal could only nod her head in agreement before following the woman through the curtain in the back of the room.
1153121111111111.title: Understanding

choices: The set that reminds her of home.
11531211111111111.content: As she follows Shiara thru the curtain, Krystal finds the room full of clothes that seem to large for her figure as she spots a set that reminds her what she usually wore on her home planet. As she walks toward it to get a look, she notices next to it is a belly dancer's uniform. She ponders on which one to wear as Shiara tells her she can wear anything she wants.
11531211111111111.title: First clothes, then food, got to handle her hun...

choices: …the building she had seen in the forest.
…a small hut in a simple village.
115312112.content:
Krystal turned her attention away from the building and towards the quick flowing river. Up close the purple hue was even more vibrant and she saw how it even dyed the soaked soil above the waterline a similar shade. Her scanner could still find no cause for the color, but nor was there any odd smell to the water either, or at least far as she could tell.

The hairs on the back of her neck suddenly stood up and the feeling that someone was out there grew stronger, but she still couldn’t tell where they were. The snap of a branch made the vixen whirl around, trying to find out where the noise was coming from. The swift motion dislodged a portion of the riverbank she was standing on causing her to lose her footing and fall into the river. Rising to the surface sputtering, she found that the churning current made getting back out difficult, as did the crumbly land bordering the river. Krystal finally managed to snag onto a protruding root and pull herself out.

Hack and coughing, she spit out some of the water, feeling more than a little angry that she hadn’t been paying much attention to her surroundings and falling in. Her irritation was partially tempered by the fact that she had found out the water didn’t taste odd either, but that was little consolation since she didn’t want to be exposed to whatever was in it yet.

The sound of footsteps swishing through grass made Krystal look up…right into the point of a spear pointed right at her. Slowly she raised her hands in what she hoped would mean to the person that she meant no harm and not insult them in some way. The figure holding the spear was covered from head to toe in a flowing hooded cloak that hid whatever body lay beneath, but Krystal could see metal and leather armor covering the arms poking out from under the cloak. More figures appeared from the shadows under the trees, all similarly attired and carrying spears. That was about all the vixen had time to see though as her vision suddenly started swimming and her head felt heavy. She flopped face down on the ground, and saw a pair of boots appear in her field of vision before she slipped into darkness.

Bits and pieces drifted through her mind: people standing over her talking in some unknown language, being carried beneath the lintel of what had to be the building she had seen the water pouring out of, an enormous statue towering over her along with voices chanting, before nothing again. When she finally came to, her throat was dry and her tongue felt like she had been licking sand for a while. Her eyes took a while to focus, but eventually she found herself in…
115312112.title: Taking a dip

1153121121.content:
Staring up at the rough stone directly overhead, Krystal tried to get her muscles working correctly. She still felt worn out though so she started to drift off again feeling the roughness of a blanket laid across her. Eyes snapping open again, she looked down and saw the blanket as well as how her suit was missing underneath. A frantic search and she found it hanging near a small fire nearby. Despite her head starting to spin, the vixen made to slide out from under the blanket and grab her suit and the back sitting nearby. She froze when she heard a nearby quiet noise.

Sitting beyond the fire at the mouth of the cave, Krystal could make out one of the cloaked figures that she had encountered. And that encounter was a while ago it seemed, judging from the near darkness outside, though the sheeting rain may have been helping with that. Seated on a small outcrop of stone facing away, Krystal couldn’t see much of anything about the figure, though she thought that maybe she could see that the shoulders were hunched forward.

Carefully, the vixen resumed slipping out from the makeshift bed she found herself lying in, but a wave of nausea was followed by an even stronger wave of vertigo. They hit hard enough that she tumbled sideways to the floor. She didn’t know how long she lay there, drifting in the limbo between conscious and unconsciousness, but she thought she briefly heard a startled shout along with a of running feet coming closer. Sometime later, she drifted awake again looking up into the face of a…
1153121121.title: A hole in the wall

choices: She’s downright plump with a rounded stomach
Fat swells her body and softens a beach ball belly
Her body is absolutely enormous, how did she miss all that?
11531211211.content:
Bright almost shining violet eyes bored into Krystal. An almost overwhelming sense of concern radiated from the person leaning over her. Something bright passed over Krystal’s face, dazzling her eyes and causing sharp stab of pain through her skull. The other muttered something but in a language that Krystal couldn’t recognize. The brightness passed as fast as it had begun. Opening her eyes a crack, Krystal saw that the other had retreated a few steps. She was looking down at something in her hand and scratching her head as she frowned.

Krystal couldn’t help but let her eyes stray down the other’s body. She was tall, very tall. The horns on her head were almost scraping the cave’s roof above. Her cloak was open, exposing more of the metal and leather armor underneath. Her attire hid much of her underlying form. Enough was visible though that Krystal could tell that the tall cow standing over her was rather well built with plenty of curves. There was a supple grace to her movements as well.

With a jolt, Krystal realized that the cow was staring at her with those violet eyes. The waves of concern faded somewhat, though not all the way. The other said something, it might have been a question, but Krystal still couldn’t understand it. Her own voice failed as a sudden coughing fit racked her body. Through tear filled eyes, the vixen saw the other lean down below the alcove. Then something pressed against Krystal’s lips and a small trickle of water wet her tongue. As the coughing started to die away, she was able to open her mouth and let more of the water in. A dark haze started to settle over her mind again before a sudden wave of vertigo crashed over her. Before she slipped under, she was dimly aware that her stomach seemed to be rumbling.

Fragments of sights, sounds, and other sensations intruded on the otherwise unbroken darkness. Krystal remembered more armored figures crowded around her, conversing in their unknown tongue. Then came a time where she was lying down on a stretcher or something, a pair of the figures carrying her between them. She managed to make out the edge of a glowing gate or something. She also remembered low hanging storm clouds as well as a clear star filled sky, though those two events seemed to be far closer together to her mind than they should have.

She awoke again, this time in a furnished room rather than in the jungle or a cave or whatever. Looking around, she found that she was in a bedroom, that was much was obvious. Soft cream colored walls with plenty of intriguing art surrounded her. The fourth wall seemed to be a floor to ceiling and wall to wall window though. That was a best guess from what little light shown through the curtains that covered it though.

She felt better rested than she had in a long time. Her head wasn’t spinning any longer and her mouth didn’t taste like the bottom of a trash can. Stretching her arms out, she ran her hands through light and airy sheets that all but flowed like water through her grasp. She frowned and furrowed her brow as she saw something that didn’t make sense. The way the sheets were falling around her body didn’t look right. It looked like she was wearing a padded suit or something. Throwing the sheet back, Krystal stared in shock at what she found.
11531211211.title: Drifting in the wind

choices: No good, got any other options for this?
1153122.content:
Perhaps while on a mission, Krystal is exposed to a chemical that will fatten her up and leave her in the family way?

Or maybe she is kidnapped and given the same chemical on purpose instead?
1153122.title: Split choice

11531222.content:
Krystal awoke with a start, before flopping back down as she felt her head pounding with the mother of all headaches. As she tried to avoid aggravating her head, she thought back to what had happened to her. She found that she couldn’t remember much of what had happened to her, only bits and pieces. She remembered exploring a distant region of space away from the Great Fox and everyone else beyond the region they had previously explored. She also remembered coming across an inhabited star system with several worlds home to people. She thought she could remember walking around one of the cities for a while, learning what she could, and then someone…grabbed her…maybe, her memories started to get really hazy around that point though. Eventually her headache eased up enough that she tried sitting up again, and was somewhat successful. She was in a lavish bedroom, lying under the covers of a large and luxurious bed. She also realized that under the covers, she was completely naked, and there was no sign of her body suit as far as she could tell.

Krystal then threw the covers back and then froze when she saw her body; it took several seconds for her to realize what she was looking at, and then it clicked: rather than her slender and trim frame that she was expecting, she was instead looking at a somewhat pudgy body, a thin but notable layer of fat added around her. Her stomach was bigger that it likely should have been and it felt a bit firmer than she was expecting too. As the shock started to wear off, the vixen pinched herself, as if to dispel the possibility of all of this being a dream, but no such luck. Gritting her teeth, Krystal got off of the bed, thinking that she could deal with her body later, after she figured out where she was. Walking around felt different due to a slight shift in her center of gravity and the feeling of extra softness wrapped around her body. Trying the doors proved fruitless, one was completely locked, and too sturdy to try breaking down. She tried anyways, and only ended up with a sore shoulder as a reward. The other led into an opulent and well furnished bathroom, which she didn’t feel like making use of, needless to say. The windows were similarly unyielding, but at least they granted her a view of a city in the distance, butting up against a lake or sea beyond, but she couldn’t tell if it was the same city she had been in before. The windows also showed that she was in a building – second floor, maybe, judging from the angle – on a grassy hill, with small copses of unfamiliar trees dotted around. Reaching out with her mind didn’t bring any new information either; something was obscuring or deadening her telepathy.

Upon hearing the door unlock, Krystal spun around, hoping to maybe get some answers and maybe a way out of here. She couldn’t see much anything beyond the door, but she could somewhat make out a person standing there, looking at her for a moment.

“Ah, good, you are awake,” said whoever was standing there, before stepping into the room, letting Krystal see who it was.
11531222.title: Taken

115312222.content: Once they stepped forward, it was easy for Krystal to see that the person walking in was a female. The species took a few moments for her to realize though.
115312222.title: The mistress of the house

choices: It’s time for breakfast, Krystal’s a growing girl.
It’s bath time, Lyra has to clean Krystal up.
It’s shopping time, and Lyra wants to show off her new girl.
1153122221.content:
She swept into the room like she owned it, and as Krystal thought about it, that could very well be true. Tall and leggy, she also possessed a voluptuous figure that stirred a little envy in the vixen. She shook her head to try and clear it; now wasn’t the time for her to be distracted, but she couldn’t help herself staring though. Luminous white fur splotched with black wrapped around the cow’s body, a body that was a much exaggerated hourglass shape: huge round breasts that defied gravity, wide shapely hips, and a little plush belly that added to her sexual stance rather than detracting. A pair of horns and somewhat long ears peeked out of the thick black waves of hair that cascaded down to her well-rounded rump, along with a white forelock that strayed in front of those limpid deep ocean blue eyes. A midnight blue dress fell from her shoulders across her body, the deep cut front exposing much of her meaty orbs, while a slit up the side let one of her shapely legs peek through.

“Hmm, nice to know that I can still inspire speechlessness,” the woman said in a sultry purr of a voice.

Krystal again shook her head, doing her best to clear away the cobwebs within. She also remembered – much to her embarrassment – that she was still completely naked. She did her best to cover up with her arms and hands, and this actually seemed to amuse the bovine before the vixen.

“Oh darling, there’s no point in you being so modest, I’ve already seen you naked before, and there will be plenty of that later as well,” the other woman said with mirth in her voice.

“Wait, what did you mean by that? And how did I get here? What am I doing here?” Krystal asked.

“You ask too many questions, but I suppose I can answer them. First, I had you brought here, you had to be knocked out first though, you looked like you might have been able to handle yourself then,” a smile crossed the woman’s face, a smile that sent a chill down Krystal’s spine. “As for your other two questions, that should be obvious, you are mine now to do as I wish. How do you not know about this?”

“I’m…not from this system, know about what?”

“I guess that should have been obvious, your style of dress, your mannerisms. Ah well, on our worlds, the upper class can take anyone they want from the lower classes and do whatever they want, as I have done to you; since you aren’t part of the nobility.”

“You mean slavery?” Krystal growled, venom seeping into her voice.

“I’m not going to send you to toil in the fields, if that’s what you mean. I just wanted a pretty little thing about the house; maybe have some fun with you. I had to make some changes to you first though.”

“Changes?” Krystal echoed, before realizing, “You mean my weight, what have you done to me?”

“I gave you a special little cocktail, enhancing your weight, yes, but the pregnancy as well,” the bovine said as she sashayed up to Krystal.

“Pregnancy!? I’m pregnant!?” she said, her hands flying to her stomach.

With dawning dread, she realized that explained why her belly felt a bit odd for just being a bit fatter: it wasn’t just fat.

“Yes, darling, I just adore the sight of a woman ripe with unborn life,” the other woman said as she circled around the vixen, “and with ample padding as well,” she added quietly as she suddenly grabbed Krystal’s rump.

Krystal jumped away, baring her teeth, “Don’t touch me, and let me go,” she demanded.

Again, the other woman flashed that chilling smile again, “Ooh, spirited, aren’t you? That will pass in time, but it will be fun for now. As for your requests, I apologize, but I won’t be able to agree with either one. As I have said before, you are mine, that collar around your lovely neck is certain proof of that,” pointing one of her slender fingers straight at Krystal, the well manicured nail glistened with blood red polish, the same red as the lipstick on those sensuous lips.

Krystal’s hands flew to her neck, her fingers clasping around unyielding metal; she hadn’t even felt it around her throat. Pulling at it provided no help, and her claws didn’t have any effect either.

“That collar means that no one in this system will dare harm you for fear of my wrath, but it also means that you aren’t escaping me,” she said it so calmly, emphasizing how serious she was.

Krystal’s hands fell to her sides again, despair settling in her heart. Then she clenched her teeth, she wasn’t going to give in that easily, no matter how she might show on the surface.

Lowering her voice and bowing her head, acting more subservient, Krystal then asked, “May I know your name?”

“Yes, you may. My name is Lyra Silverton, but you may call me Mistress,” the bovine purred out, giving a haughty grin as she did so.
1153122221.title: The bovine in charge

choices: Krystal’s been such a messy girl that Lyra has to clean her up.
Breakfast isn’t done yet, it’s time for the second course.
Lyra has something fun in store for Krystal now.
11531222211.content:
“Of course,” Krystal said, and then forced herself to say, “Mistress.”

This only widened the haughty smile on Lyra’s face, before she said, “Come along, darling, I’m sure you’re getting hungry.”

Krystal started to say no, but almost as if on cue, her stomach let out an angry rumble. This caused the vixen to instead nod her head and follow the bovine out of the room. As they walked along, Krystal tried to keep her attention on her surroundings to learn what she could and see if anything could be useful in an escape attempt, but instead her eyes kept getting drawn back to the rolling rump of Lyra in front of her. The bovine even seemed to be aware of this, judging from the sly grin she gave when looking back over her shoulder and the way that she added a little extra swagger to her walk, just to add some bounce to her butt. Eventually they came to a small but opulent dining room with the table already laden with numerous edibles, with more being delivered by service droids. Despite attempts at controlling herself, Krystal felt her mouth start to water as the smells hit her nose, followed by her stomach growing even louder and longer than before. Hearing Lyra go “Ah-ah-ah” brought Krystal up short, and made her realize that she had been marching towards the food without any conscious thought.

Lyra then walked up around the vixen, one finger tracing across the slight plush layer, while saying, “Patience, my pet, you can eat your fill and then some, but only when I say so. Understand?”

Krystal found herself nodding despite her brain’s objections; the hunger was getting to be too much. Grabbing her arm rather roughly, Lyra led Krystal to a pair of seats at one end of the table; taking the more throne like of the two, while pushing the vixen into the other one. Every second stretched out into an agonizing eternity for Krystal, her hunger constantly gnawing away on her insides and making it feel like she was digesting herself, and yet Lyra was still content to take it slow and easy, dishing up a plate for herself and giving occasional sly grins to “her pet”. Some small portion of her mind figured that chemical cocktail had to have something to do with this insane hunger, but it barely registered to the rest of Krystal.

Finally, just when the vixen was sure she was going to pass out from starvation, Lyra sat back and simply said, “Now.”

With that, Krystal lost all conscious control of her body, and she threw herself at the food, shoveling anything in reach into her slavering maw. She didn’t care that she was already coating her fur in a layer of grease, gravy, and other bits and globs of food; the only thing that mattered was getting food into her mouth. The vixen was so lost in the food frenzy that she almost missed the fact that Lyra let loose with a peal of laughter as she watched the vixen tear into the food with such reckless abandon. Lyra was careful to keep her plate well clear of the spectacle happening atop the table though.

Again, a portion of Krystal’s mind realized just how much she was eating, but it couldn’t stop what was happening. Her gut continued to swell further and further as more and more food was shoved in, far beyond anything that should have been possible. Some of the service drones moved plates and platters closer to Krystal, but more than a few went spinning away as she tore at the food before they had even placed them down, often hitting or even damaging the drones in the process.

Finally, with a thunderous belch, Krystal found herself beached in the middle of the table, chomping down on several pieces of bacon while at the same time licking the combined gobs of goo that formed on her other hand. She groaned loudly as the realization of what had just happened hit her, as well as the feelings that her overstuffed stomach was relying to her mind. The bovine gave another loud laugh and even clapped her hands several times, very much enjoying what she had just witnessed.

“My, my, that went better than it ever has before. It was more than a little messy, but still quite enjoyable. I can tell we are going to have much fun together, you and I,” she said, standing up and poking and prodding Krystal’s swollen gut, causing several more belches.

Krystal could just barely make out Lyra’s face, and the wide grin that split it.
11531222211.title: Mealtime

115312222111.content:
The next thing Krystal knew, she was warm and very wet. Cracking her eyes open, she was greeted by a steam filled bathroom, and found that she was half-sitting half-floating in a huge bathtub sunk into the floor. She was still dealing with her extremely bloated stomach, and her fur was still caked and stained with the remains of her gluttony, gluttony that had been somehow forced on her by that cow along with everything else done to her. The vixen’s head flopped back as she ground her teeth together and screwed her eyes shut, but suddenly jumped as she felt a wet cloth rubbing across her body. Opening her eyes open again, she that it was as she expecting: Lyra was in the bath with her and was currently washing away the crusty and gooey patches across her “pet’s” fur. Krystal tried to suppress the grimace that threatened to come over her face upon seeing that, and was more than a little shocked at how easy that proved to be.

“I have to compliment you, darling, as I said before, I’ve never seen it work quite as well as it did for you,” the bovine said, flashing that smile again.

Krystal tried to resist taking that as a compliment, but found herself smiling at the praise despite herself. choices: Let's Go With The Star Fox Command Ending!
Let's Start This Story Somewhere Else...
1213311.content:
Before we begin, I would just like to point out where we are in the Star Fox timeline. Before this, I knew very little about Star Fox. Whether it be games, vehicles, locations, or characters, I knew I had to learn a few things before I do this rewrite, since my idea is very complex. I mainly read most of what I now know from the Star Fox wiki,

http://starfox.wikia.com/wiki/Main_Page

That said, I want to make sure you know where my story takes place in the grand scheme of things, as this affects the story. From what I read about Krystal, Fox, and the other members of the Star Fox cast, there are a lot of different incidents and things that tie into Krystal and Fox's relationship. However, for me, it all boils down to a game called Star Fox Command.

In this game, depending on which path you take in-game, when you beat the game, there will be a different ending. These endings are very diverse. In one instance, Fox leaves the Star Fox team to be with Krystal and live the quiet life, at which point he has a son named Marcus. In another, Krystal leaves the team and joins Star Wolf, Star Fox's rival. There's even an ending where Krystal becomes a bounty hunter named Kursed!

Among these endings, I found one I would like to use.

In this ending, Fox convinces Krystal to stay with the Star Fox team with some help from Slippy and Falco. I thought this would be a good place to start, so I decided to use this ending. Of course, this story takes place after said ending.

There are some things to remember about this game and its endings. In Star Fox Command, Peppy Hare actually takes General Pepper's place as General of the Cornerian Army. Obviously, this means he is no longer a part of the Star Fox Team. Therefore, he doesn't play as big of a part in my story as he did in Star Fox Command. He'll probably appear only once or twice.

Another important thing to remember is that, in this ending, the Star Fox team gets a new member! Aside from Fox promising Krystal that they'll be together forever, Slippy Toad gets married to Amanda, a pink frog who joins the Star Fox team to be closer to Slippy. For full details, please read the wiki.

That said, do you want to start this story from my chosen ending, or start it from a different point in the Star Fox timeline?

"Huh." Krystal stood up as she took in the sight. "Fancy that."

         It was a rather ancient-looking temple. The stone blocks it was made of, presumably once intended to shine with a golden brilliance, were showing many years' worth of decay. Any luster they might have once had faded away to a muddy yellow with plenty of missing bits and pieces. Moss and vines had grown all over, and most of the structure itself was slightly obscured by a small group of trees. A rather typical-looking temple structure, save for the river Krystal was following. Between two of the trees and off to the side of the main entrance, an opening was letting the water flow through.

         The blue vixen scratched her chin. "So I'm on a planet I know nothing about, drinking from a river that goes from salty to sweet as I go further up, and it seems to come from this deserted temple." She put her hands on her hips. "Must be one of those places, then. Still, I'd have to be the most unadventurous lady in the galaxy to not look inside."

         Nodding to herself, Krystal began to walk over to the temple. She only hoped that whatever crazy thing was probably going to happen to her wouldn't be too terrible.

------

The main entrance only led to a circular platform with nothing more than a podium of sorts. What really stuck out was the water surrounding the platform. More specifically, the fact that the water really did seem to come from the temple itself. Fountains perched on the walls poured steady streams down to the ground below, which then flowed out the side opening.

         It actually does come from here? How strange.

         Thirst was no longer an issue for Krystal at that point, so she made her way over to the podium. Engraved on its surface was a paragraph in a language she had never seen before. To you who can read these words, know that your life has become something better.

1351.content:
Krystal gazed blankly at the milky white body floating among the various stars that littered the open space in front of the Great Fox. The locals had a name for it, Ymir, the frost giant. A planet so cold that it perpetually remained below Celsius all year round. It was one of the furthermost planet from the sun in the Lylat System, thought to be an inhabitable snowy wasteland with no life that dared to set foot on it. That is, until the Great Fox received an S.O.S transmission from the planet just two days ago.

Life had apparently stubbornly clung to the frozen crust of Ymir, a far-reaching section of the Cornerian Underground Spec-Ops division had set up a base of operations on the planet supposedly for the sole reason that no enemies would bother searching the planet for a hidden base. They were proven wrong, the details were vague in the message but they were under attack by some unknown force and their base was completely overrun. Being in an outpost so far from Corneria, they had no way of contacting anyone. The Great Fox only just received the transmission out of pure luck after returning from a successful mission in Sector Z and being in the area while heading home.

That's where Krystal's new assignment came in, for she was the one that sensed the distress signal in the first place.

"Krystal!" Cried a high pitched voice, interrupting the vixen's thoughts. "Krrrrrystal!"

She sighed. "What is it Slippy?"

The toad mechanic gently tugged Krystal's right sleeve in the manner a child would when consulting its mother. "Falco stole my gyro-driver and he won't give it back. He doesn't listen to me, can you tell him to stop?"

"Slippy, I am not your mother..."

"But Krystal..."

"Enough! Stop acting like a child!"

Krystal grasped her forehead from the sudden migraine Slippy was giving. Her new assignment was to be the one who scouted the planet for any signs of the hidden base. Because of the thick icestorms on the surface, traditional radio transmissions and planet scanning were not options. The team would be relying on her telepathy to locate the base. Though there was a danger of getting in the storm, that wasn't what was worrying Krystal though. Despite be covered in fur like most foxes, she absolutely hated the cold. A journey to Ymir was the last thing she wanted to do, even Fox had pushed the others into dropping the mission until the scanning equipment would work. But they all eventually agreed, there wasn't time to spare. She would be leaving for Ymir by Arwing in a couple of minutes.

"Look, Slippy, you know I'm going planetside soon. I can't waste time here playing mom with the rest of you. As much as I don't want to go to Ymir..."

Something clicked in Slippy's head. "Oh yeah! I finished adding that special addition to your Arwing, it's all set for launch!"

The special addition to her Arwing was a full ship super heater that would generate enough heat to keep her fighter warm the entire mission. It would make her job that much more easier.

"Good, thank you." She turned to leave.

"Wait, where are you going!?" He ran to catch up to her but the blast door closed right in his face. "Darn...I'm sure there's something I forgot to tell her about heaters...Oh well..."

~

Thirty minutes later, Krystal was clear for take off and sped out of the hanger straight for Ymir's atmosphere. As she cleared the thick gray hail clouds, the windows of the Arwing all started to freeze up. The thermometer read -70 Celsius outside, enough for anyone to freeze to death instantly if they weren't prepared. Krystal sighed contently in the cockpit of her Arwing.

It felt like summer inside, a drastic contrast between the freezing outside. Hail battered the hull of the Arwing, but Krystal wasn't even shivering. The heat blew in at full blast as Krystal tried to concentrate "hearing" for another signal from the base.

Her Arwing finally reached the surface of the planet after about a minute of nosediving through the storm clouds. The ground was covered with snow, as would be expected. Not a single patch of brown or black tainted the pearly white pillow of snow. If it weren't for the computer navigating the terrain, Krystal probably wouldn't be able to tell the difference between the sky and the ground. At least it was a little warmer on the surface, only -40 Celsius.

As her Arwing gracefully tumbled to and from the great mountains that littered the surface of the planet, Krystal picked up something.

"...Help..........Many...Them...."

She furrowed her brow, trying to pinpoint the direction of the beacon. The voice came in a little stronger this time.

"....Turn.....Back..."

Just when she almost had the direction it was coming in, a blaring warning flashed up on her Arwing's computer screen. "WARNING: FUEL LEVELS LOW" The dial of the fuel was nearing empty when a computer voice filled the cockpit.

"Warning. Fuel dangerously low. Emergency landing equipment engaged."

It only took a full heartbeat for Krystal to understand what was going on. "Slippy!"

The added heaters had to get their energy from somewhere, and the only suitable source would have to be the fuel for the main engine. Combined with that and the extra energy required to fly through the storm, the Arwing couldn't maintain flight.

Krystal closed her eyes as her ship tumbled nose first into a pile of snow. Her body jolted as the ship came to a sudden stop. Snow was all around the windows of the cockpit as the temperature in the ship steadily dropped.

"I'm going to kill him..." Muttered Krystal as she kicked open the window and dug her way through the snow. Her Arwing was encased in a good five feet of the stuff, when she finally clawed her way to the surface. It was a dreaded sight that greeted her.

She had landed in a giant plain of snow. There was nothing for miles on all sides of her. The razor winds of the storm caused her to wrap her arms around herself in a feeble attempt to warm herself. This was bad. Nothing could be seen anywhere except...
1351.title: Journey to Ymir.

13511.content:
The only thing even remotely close to Krystal was a giant mountain covered with snow from ground to peak. But what was heartening about the sight was a small black cave-like opening not too far up the base with a path leading to it. It was the only thing that promised shelter from this terrible snow storm. Krystal shivered as her fur was getting powdered by the blinding ice and hail, she didn't have many options at this point.

Moving as quickly as she could, she gathered up all the intact supplies on the crashed Arwing. There wasn't a lot she brought with her, an emergency blanket, some flares, her staff, and a few small food rations. Even with this equipment Krystal probably wouldn't be able to last that long on this planet and unless she got to shelter soon, she would not be able to survive even a night. Her only hope was to make for the cave and hope Fox and the others came down to rescue her.

Wrapping herself with the blanket like a cloak, she trudged her way through the icy plains.

It felt like hours had passed as she walked through snow that went up to her waist. She couldn't even feel her feet at this point, even with the insulated boots and a layer of fur. She could almost feel herself passing in and out of consciousness as the mountain slowly got closer and closer.

Finally, after what seemed like an eternity, she found herself face to face with the mouth of the cave.

A wave of heat swept over Krystal's shivering form, it was almost as it the cave itself was breathing. "H-Hello!?" She called out.

There was no answer, just the howl of the wind blowing through the cracks in the opening of the ceiling. But Krystal still couldn't shake the eerie feeling that she wasn't alone in the cave. But her body wouldn't give her time to be afraid, her legs finally buckled under the strain of holding herself up. She needed to get a fire going, and fast. Unfortunately, the only thing flammable she had on her that was expendable was her backpack. Pouring all of it's contents on the floor of the cave, she set the sack in the middle of a small dip. She then took one of the flares and sparked her makeshift kindling to life.

The fire made the cave almost come alive. It lit up the dark corners of the caverns as well as warming up the frozen vixen. Little did she know, however, the bright flames also alerted what was also in the cave with her....

135111.content:
Huddled around the flame, Krystal did all she could to try to keep warm. Even though her arms were practically in the fire at this point, she couldn't feel any heat. In fact, she couldn't feel anything. Every part of her body was numb, she was sure she was getting frostbite.

Cursing Slippy yet another time, she wrapped herself in the snow covered blanket she had managed to grab and desperately tried to warm herself with her own body heat. She felt like the last bit of a candle about to go out with a small gust of the wind. This wasn't a normal chill, this stabbed her to the bone. Outside the cave, razor sharp winds cut the air making Krystal shiver at the thought of facing them again.

How long had it been since the crash? How long had it been since she had started the fire? Her ship crashing seemed to happen days ago, but no it had to have only happened just a few hours ago didn't it? Surely Fox and the others would notice something was wrong by now. Surely they'd come looking for her, before she...Before she...

Krystal shuddered at the frightful thought that entered her head, being stuck in a cave as a frozen solid corpse for all eternity. She wasn't going to die here, she couldn't die here.

Despairing, she looked up at the roof of the cave and shouted telepathically hoping to reach someone, or something. "Is anyone out there!?!?"

But all that responded was the silent howl of the cave, like the wind in the dead of winter. Krystal grabbed her knees, about ready to give up hope.

"I hear you, young one." A deep voice tickled her mind and rattled the cave.

Krystal spun around facing the darkness of the cave. Her eyes met a pair of two great yellow orbs floating in the blackness surrounding her. In any normal situation, she might have reached for her staff to defend herself, but right now she was too weak to fend off whatever foul creature this was. Her only hope was to reason with this monster.

"Who are you? What do you want?"

"If you continue to stay out unprotected such as that, you will certainly die."

Krystal huffed angrily. "Is that what you're waiting for? For me to freeze to death before you move in for the kill?"

"Your kind come into these frozen wastes so ill prepared, it would be just to let you suffer your own fate for intruding on our refuge."

"If you aren't going to help me, then leave me be please. Once my friends find me, you'll regret coming near me." That was a bluff, but it was all she could muster at this point. Whatever this was, it seemed reasonable. Perhaps reasonable enough to leave her in peace.

"The storm outside disrupts all forms of communication that your technology permits. And your mind powers, though impressive for one such as you, are too meager. They will only reach those with the ears to hear it in a short range."

Krystal quickly decided if she was going to have any hope of getting out of here, she'd need to keep this thing talking as much as possible. "One such as you?"

The voice hesitated as the orbs of light blinked and shifted around slightly. "I must admit, you are unlike the others of your kind. None I have met possess the mind powers. Perhaps you are different."

"Different?"

"...They came. Driving us from our homes and dens. Forcing us, our young, into the cold during the last great storm. Many died. We learned to distrust your kind. We learned to hate them."

"Are you the reason we lost communication with our base then?"

The orbs shifted again. "No."

"But you still hate us?"

"Hate was not something we Icewalkers were born with. Our home was without conflict before your kind came. So we came to hate them. To curse them. But never strike against them. Only bid our time. Yet, you are different."

"Different? How?"

The orbs then approached her, closer and closer. Until at last Krystal saw that they were not orbs of light, but two large eyes attached to a humongous white bear. The bear's head was almost half the size of Krystal herself, and it's blank fur was covered with odd markings. Intimidating was the very least Krystal could say about this monster.

"You are the first of your kind to speak to one of mine."

"Y-You're a bear?"

"A bear? I do not know this word. I am Urso of the Icewalkers. Speak, what is your name."

"K-Krystal."

"What a beautiful name. It reminds me of the many shards of ice that decorate the roof of my home."

"You mean this cave?"

"What remains of it. This used to be a sprawling hall full of life and my kin. Now, it is all but abandoned save for the ghosts and the ancients. We are the only ones who remain among the living here."

This was all becoming very fascinating, but a sudden gust of cold wind blew out what remained of Krystal's fire. The cave was flooded with darkness as she suddenly realized she could no longer feel most of her limbs.

"As I told you, if you continue to stay out unprotected you will die."

"Please!" she begged the bear. "I have no quarrel with your kind. I'm not even from this planet! I just need to find someway to stay alive. Please, anything!"

The orbs of yellow light that was Urso's eyes shifted around again. The bear seemed to be debating with itself, growling in the darkness of the cave. Until at last Urso came to some sort of agreement.

"I shall show you how to survive, but if you choose to use our ways is up to you."
